Reviews.Title: “false advertising”
Reviews.Author: Deon D
Reviews.Content: Booked a "larger guest room". The room that we ended up in was very different to what was reflected on the photographs for a larger guest room on the hotel website. When I queried this they said the photo's are "just an example". This started our visit on the wrong foot seeing that expectations created were not met. Deon

Reviews.Title: “A park oasis in the middle of Paris”
Reviews.Author: jenabaindelhi
Reviews.Content: Classy hotel, very friendly staff (especially for Paris), and large rooms (again, for Paris). We stayed in the annex (Detente), with larger and quieter rooms and a great view on the large garden/patio area. Especially comfy bed/pillows and well appointed room/amenities. The garden really adds to this hotel, and you can have drinks/snacks in the comfortable chairs/sofas surrounded by magnolia trees, flowers and other greenery. We really enjoyed coming off the streets of Paris into the garden on the way to our room. The staff at reception, concierge and breakfast area were all very friendly and helpful, especially for Paris. I've at this same hotel a few years ago when it was Sofitel, and now that it's Renaissance/Marriott, service has *definitely* improved. Breakfast was included in the room, which was a good deal since otherwise the full bfast buffet is 29 euros/person (steep!). There are several nice restaurants, lots of cute shops, two supermarkets, pharmacies, etc., in the area-- and a 7-10 min walk to the Trocadero, the Arc de Triomphe, or the shops on the Champs Ellysee. Also 7-10 min walk to 3-4 different metro stations. Overall, this hotel is a good value and good location-- highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, clean and courteous”
Reviews.Author: Chrissy B
Reviews.Content: While a bit pricey, from our research they are right on par with other hotels in the area, perhaps slightly less than some. Our room was a suite with a separate living area and one and a half bathrooms. The room was spotless and comfortable. From what I understand, large compared to a lot of European hotels. The room had everything we needed. The front desk staff and conceirge were very helpful and extremely courteous. We arrived much earlier than expected after a long night of travelling and were delighted to find out that it was not so busy and a room was ready for us. Nice location, easy 20 min leisurely walk to Eiffel Tower, a few minutes from the Arc and Champs Elysses. We even ventured a long walk from the Louvre to see some other sights. All in all this hotel is conveniently located for everything we wanted to do. We only wish there had been a pool!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and worth to try”
Reviews.Author: Rouniuyizu
Reviews.Content: I stayed there using points (as platnium member), and I felt being well treated as expected. We got promoted to junior suite with the glance to Effie tower, and since there is not lounge in the hotel, we are given the access to full breakfast (seems to be the same for all the Marriott hotels I stayed in downtown).

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel in quiet neighborhood close to Palais de Congres convention center”
Reviews.Author: Orso52
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Paris Hotel Le Parc Trocadero is a four-star Marriott property with a boutique like feel tucked away in the quiet 16th arrondissement. It is a pretty short Metro or taxi ride to the Palais de Congres convention center. Recently rennovated, the rooms are light and airy and kept clean and comfortable. The restaurant does well for all three meals, though it is not cheap. The bar service is friendly. The fitness center is a joke, with one orbital machine, one stationary bike and a few free weights. Not even a treadmill.

Reviews.Title: “Winter in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: miscaorg
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms with my reward points for three nights for me and my adult children. As a platinum elite, I was not treated as such upon arrival as they didn't have the rooms that I had requested 3 months prior. They did not reserve the rooms that matched my profile/preferences. Hotel is nice and remodeled but having a room over the kitchen back door was loud with opening and closing. Hotel heating was much too hot, and the window had to be opened with the heater turned off in the room. Breakfasts were adequate, and the staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Feel of a boutique hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: philsdottir
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 9 days in February, when I was in Paris on business. Even though it was definitely high end and was very well apportioned and felt boutique-y, it wasn't cliquey or snobby in the least. Reception/Lobby - The check-in at this hotel was very efficient. They had all my information and it was very fast. For those who like this kind of thing, they had a bellman ready to take your suitcases up (I had only one bag and didn't need that). Check-out was equally easy and everyone was really super nice. Everyone spoke English well. I was in the main building. There are 2 elevators. There are more rooms across the courtyard but I didn't see them. Room - very well apportioned. My room was fairly big but two colleagues' rooms were quite small. All had pretty much the same furniture in it though. It is very much retro 1970s look, which worked for me - I loved it,, and I love that the overall theme in the decoration is green, it is unique and cheery. Big healthy closet with lots of hangers. The sheets were cool and crisp to climb into, there were tons of pillows to sleep on, and the comforter was soooo comfy. I wish my bed at home was this comfortable. A nice touch was the ipod docking station/stereo. There was also a flat panel TV, a safe, a pretty large wardrobe with lots of hangers, a hot pot with teas and coffees, and a minibar with space in the fridge so you could put in a couple of cans of soda or bottles of water of your own. The TV has a lot of channels and half a dozen or so are in English, unfortunately they are all news channels and it gets pretty boring watching all news all the time. The curtains are real blackout curtains and you can't see any light through them when they are closed, even at 10 am! (So, if you want to wake up using sunlight, leave them cracked or partly open.) There are slippers and sewing kit. The bathroom has nice smelling soap, lotion, shampoo and bath gel. No conditioner. The towels are not big - the bath towels are pretty small, maybe bath towel and not bath sheet - but they are really fluffy and thick. The hair dryer is in the closet. The shower head is the rainshower type and there was lots of hot water. It was just that half-glass popular in Europe (no doors or shower curtains) so every day I pretty much made a mess with the shower on the bathroom floor. The problem was actually that there wasn't that rubber squeegee bumper on the bottom of the glass so there was a small gap between the glass and the tub. There is turndown service, which is nice, although one day I had the do not disturb sign on the door and they came in and removed the sign and did the turndown service anyhow. I thought that wasn't good, but since I was really just trying to save them the trouble of doing my room - I didn't need housekeeping every day! - I didn't make a big deal out of it. I recommend the turndown service because they leave you Toblerone minibars and chocolates from la maison du chocolat! There was a tea bar which was great with hot pot. Every day I was able to have a couple of cups of NICE tea - berry teas, Earl Grey, mint - it was super and they replenished it. There was also a bottle of Evian complimentary - and they replaced that too, as you drank it. The fridge in the minibar has space for a couple of small bottles of water, cans of soda or cups of yoghurt if you want to put them in. There is internet in the room via ethernet cord (so bring your laptop, your tablet won't work). However, you should be warned that internet is really expensive - something like 20 euros a day or 100 euros a week. This is dismaying as the hotel itself is not cheap, and there's no reason they can't offer free internet or wifi - the hotel I usually stay in just around the corner isn't as nice or as expensive as this one, and they offer free wifi. Amenities (courtyard, bar, fitness center) - the courtyard looks nice and I know there are opportunities to eat and drink there in nicer months but I didn't have these opportunities in February! The bar is nice but not cheap. It's not horribly expensive but it can add up. Beer was 8-10 euro, a caipirhina was 14 euro. The hotel has a really nice lounging area, and we hung out there a couple of times. Fitness center was pretty good - it's not Ballys but I think it's the best one I've seen in a Paris hotel. About half a dozen machines, and an area for yoga and stretching. And 24 hour access with your room key. It's in the basement. There is room service available 24 hours but I didn't get any so I can't vouch for it. Breakfast - Breakfast was great. For a hotel-provided breakfast, there was a lot to choose from. One part had hot foods like eggs, stewed tomatoes, mushrooms and potatoes, one part had cereals and a variety of juices and milk (even skim! yay!), one part had pastries and croissants and one part had salad, meats, olives, fruits, eggs, etc. They were in different places in the breakfast room which was nice because it avoided bunching all in one area and having to wait in line, etc. The use of space was smart. The breakfast room has this ceiling that's a big tapestry of a map of Paris - pretty cool. It's small, and sometimes it fills up in which case they open up the restaurant adjacent for the overflow. They offer coffee or tea, and then the y bring a nice yogurt-compote thing that's berry-flavored kind of a breakfast amuse-bouche. Now for me the breakfast was included and I obviously liked it. But normally it's 29 euros, and would I pay 29 euros for breakfast? Naw. Concierge/"Navigator" - They have what they call their "navigator" who is basically a concierge. I don't usually avail myself of concierge services (okay I don't usually stay in places with one), but I used this for getting taxis multiple times during the week, finding out a restaurant that we could go to nearby that had space on Valentine's Day without a reservation, and for directing me on a free weekend day. This was the kind of funny thing that happened, and for a while I was not sure he spoke English. I went to him and told him in French that I had a question for him but I'd like to ask it in English because it would be easier, is that okay. He replied no, I must speak in French. I couldn't tell if he was being serious, or if he was teasing me or challenging me to speak French. It was fine, I muddled through it in my bad French and he was great - I don't know what would have happened if I really only could speak English - I explained that normally I go to the St Ouen marche aux puces and where else could I go. He was able from our conversation to get a sense of what I appreciated and liked, and then made a couple of recommendations and told me where I would appreciate, showed me on the map the Metro stop etc., and I was off. And he was spot-on. It was kind of funny because I specifically did not want to do the touristy thing, but something more local and involved, and he got that intuitively and respected it - and not only that but knew some of the more obscure places to direct me to. Much appreciated! Especially given the location here, and the number of tourists probably wanting to go to the Eiffel Tower or Etoile. Location - So speaking of location, I like this location. The hotel is very near to a number of Metro stops, including Victor Hugo, Torcadero, Boissere, Kleber. You can walk to Trocadero, Passy and la Muette, the Champs-Elysee. There are many restaurants in the neighborhood that are not tourist traps (avoid the ones on the circle in Trocadero) such as Victor and Brasserie la Poste, XVIIIe and Mandarin de Ming. There are a number of small groceries nearby as well, for the basics and not so basics.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ctanski
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the Eiffel tower, and subway system. The rooms were clean and spacious, the hotel staff is excellent. Take the subway everywhere. Or the Rouge car, which is a hop on hop off bus, it will stop at all major attractions and very near to the hotel. The hotel is on a quiet street, and very safe. I felt safe everywhere in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “paris-oct 2010”
Reviews.Author: hybw
Reviews.Content: terrific treatment, great location and excellent breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and stylish in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: TravellinGuy58
Reviews.Content: Located in a quiet area with some nice bistros. Close to Metro. Recently renovated. Rooms better quality furnishing and larger than many 4 and 5 star in Paris. Currently my favorite Paris hotel. Staff very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in the quiet Trocadero area”
Reviews.Author: Sheherazade70
Reviews.Content: The property was exquisitely beautiful with lovely service from start to finish. Our room wasn't very large but it was extremely well-appointed with good quality linens and toiletries (fabulous bathroom) with a mini-balcony overlooking the elegantly decorated courtyard. The restaurant was delicious and there were many non-touristy cafes nearby where we enjoyed dining. As is the case in any major city, hotel restaurants tend to be pricey but in my opinion the dinner was well worth it. I'd opt for a local bistro for breakfast. The only flaw with our stay was that I had to call for housekeeping 3x. To the management's credit they sent up a beautifully typed apology note with a glass of champagne---a lovely gesture that was greatly appreciated but for a 5-Star property of this caliber I would expect a more proficient, attentive housekeeping staff. It didn't ruin our lovely stay--but it's an area that could use some attention. Other than that--it was a most *wonderful stay.* If you're looking to experience a true Parisian neighborhood free from the razzle dazzle of more crowded neighborhoods, look no further---this hotel is romantic and elegant. I can't wait to return later this spring.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but average”
Reviews.Author: bengalitraveller
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times during work trips. Great location to the office, and centrally located, plus near the metro, good for getting around. Some marvellous restaurants nearby! The rooms, however, are quite small and look a little aged - not in a good way. Service, however, is great, and overall this is a perfectly adequate place to stay. Not sure that I would book it for a couples/family getaway though.

Reviews.Title: “Great NYE”
Reviews.Author: flashpacker001
Reviews.Content: Good location, close to everything we needed. The neighborhood is quiet and feels very safe. Room size is good for Paris with a large (ish) bathroom. Bed was comfy. Service was good. On the downside, the TV only had english news channels, no movies etc. That said after a vin rouge or two with dinner in the city of lights who needs TV!

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: CindyCR
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an executive suite with our two teenage boys. The room had a loft with a king size bed that gave us our privacy. The boys were happy in the sofabed downstairs with a big screen tv. The hotel is on a quiet street about 10 min. Walk from the Eiffel tower and 15 mins from the champs élysées. The room also had a lovely view overlooking a courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Original Room, Good Service, Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Pedro G
Reviews.Content: We loved the room we stayed in, it was a two level room with very nice touches, the staff was very attentive (except for the restaurant staff, so I won´t rate them as excellent) and within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower, the Arch of the Triumph, a Metro Station and a Bus Station. You are ready to enjoy Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was a 9 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: Ayesha Z
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance was conviently located 9 minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower. The hotel had recently undergone an elegant renovation, and things were stylish, however, the bathroom shower renovation was not well thought out. The Glass door was too short and allowed water to spray all over the floor. We had a little trouble ordering room service as our french was limited.

Reviews.Title: “5 star design hotel with a 3 star service - too expensive for what you get, lacking service”
Reviews.Author: ILT186338
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights at 360 EUR per night. 5 star design hotel with a 3 star service. Rooms are good and quite spacious for Paris with small balcony. Unfortunately our balcony was facing the back where the restaurant terrace and hotel bar is located therefore it was very noisy in the evenings. Comfortable bed and high quality bed linen. Tea/coffee making facility. Although we had booked a double room for 2 people there was just 1 tea cup, 1 coffee mug, 1 pair of slippers and 1 bathrobe provided. That's not 5 star service. Staff is average. Ladies at the Check in/out were very friendly and welcoming. Worst concierge I have ever met. Unfriendly and not very helpful at all. Concierge did not had manners you would expect at such a hotel and did not have good knowledge at all. For example: We had asked for directions to Parc Monceau. All he said was "that's a beautiful park", at that time there was a exhibition of Chinese arts and the park is famous for it's architectural features so you would expect a well trained concierge to give a little more information about the park. There was one DIN A4 information/guide given to us when we checked in. The English version is so simple and full of typos so that it is more a guide to have a good laugh than to take any new information with you. A 5 star hotel should be able to provide good quality when it comes to translation/information. They provide an app for smart phones which is supposed to give some more knowledge about restaurants, things to see and do but it was not possible to download the app at the lobby. The first thing the concierge told me was that my device must be having issues. He tried to download it with his device and it did not work! Instead of an apology and giving the guest the feeling that he will get in contact with the responsible person we were just told that it is not working. We tried to download the app at a free WIFI spot at a park later and it was no problem at all. But after looking into it I would not recommend this app as it is pretty average and not helpful at all. WIFI at the lobby is incredible weak and slow. The only newspaper that was provided in the lobby was China daily. Although we stayed there for 2 nights we did not see any Chinese people at all. What's the point in not providing some other international newspapers? As we stayed at a 4 star rated hotel in Paris a few days later we would not recommend this 5 star hotel at all. The price that you pay is far to high for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “What's Missing”
Reviews.Author: rarguez
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in an upscale area of Paris. What is striking is what's missing. The gym consists of a treadmill, elliptical, bike and bench with dumbbells unto 25 pounds. The other thing that is missing is the TV channels. English TV means you are watching the news-period. For this price I expect more.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location to stay in”
Reviews.Author: Taguirre131
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the renaissance Trocadero for 5 nights and we found it quite satisfactory. The location is excellent. I like the quiet surroundings when you step out of the hotel and the shops close by. I also liked the idea of having security personnel of the hotel positioned outside. The garden or patio at the back of the hotel was also a very pleasing sight to see as you walk to your room. The staff were very courteous and helpful and special mention should be made of Joseph, the concierge. He was very gracious and accommodating. He was able to assist us with certain concerns regarding the location of a store or restaurant, the securing of tickets to a show and certain queries regarding detax. The standard room we got was satisfactory. It was a bit tight but we managed to fit our luggages. The bed was comfortable. There was a luggage rack and full length mirror. The bathroom was clean and so were the towels. I didn't like the shower enclosure too much because the glass partition was too small so the floor would easily get wet. The shower head would have been better if it could be adjusted farther away from the wall. I liked the idea of separating the water closet from the shower enclosure. Tissue paper should have been provided in the main bathrooms and there were no slippers for the guests. I requested from the front desk but they did not send any slippers to my room during our stay. We tried having breakfast in the main dining area one morning. Food was tasty but a bit expensive. If return to Paris, I would stay again in this hotel because of its excellent location and quiet surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelLovers2
Reviews.Content: We liked the Renaissance because of its location. The room was nice, a typical european room with a crazy shower. How do they expect you to take a shower without a curtain or door? Also, the tub is very high to get in and out. I wonder how many people have slipped. There were only two issues with our stay. One night we were very tired and decided to eat at the hotel restaurant at around 7:30pm. We were asked if we had reservations. The restaurant was empty except for one couple. We said no and they looked like they were going to do us a favor. During the 1.5 hrs we were there eating the very pricy dinner, only one couple showed up. Very pricy and definitely not worth it. They have a famous macaroni listed on the room service menu for 20 euros, at the restaurant it was 21 euros. C'mon!! Macaroni with ham for 21 euros!!! Ridiculous. My husband asked for half a bottle of wine and they brought an entire bottle and charged us for it. We thought they were going to pour half and take the rest. Needless to say we didnt finish it because we only had one more night in Paris. Also, if you ask for a taxi at a certain time, make sure the taxi is not there earlier charging you. We were checking out at 6 am and asked for a taxi at 6:15am. When we looked the taxi was already there and nobody had told us. The taxi had been charging us for being there, so before we even sat down we owed him 8 euros. The location is what really attracted us to this hotel and would definitely stay there again. Just be aware that the stree area is very dark at night, but nothing happened.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Emotions...”
Reviews.Author: Chavetto
Reviews.Content: Overall it was a great Hotel but I am glad we used points rather than pay their crazy room prices. That being said they did a great job. Without notice they recognized it was my birthday and brought us a dessert tray of fine cheese and bread and a half bottle of wine. Impressive. After returning from Venice they upgraded us to a romantic room with a Bathtub with a view. The area was just O.K. but I liked that it was close to major tourist sites. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: Aissabc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were visiting Paris with some friends and stayed at the hotel for 5 nights. The rooms were not too small and could fit two luggages in a small corner of the room. It was just unfortunate that there were no luggage racks (foldable type) in the room which required one to bend down just to get to one's clothes as there was not enough wardrobe space or drawers. I love the separate WC and bathroom but I hated the small glass panel in the bath which was just too small and made the bathroom floor all wet after a shower. Beds were very comfortable and rooms were clean. Service staff at the check-in we're all very helpful and courteous and special mention must be given to Joseph the concierge who was very very helpful and friendly. The hotel is conveniently located to Place Victor Hugo and metro stations Victor Hugo and Trocadero. I would definitely stay here on a return trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “just book this one”
Reviews.Author: kygogirl
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful time of year we had in October in Paris and two nights a tthis location helped the dream come true! This is such a comfortable and classy hotel. Our room was in the courtyard area off the restaurant patio and we had a private table to enjoy our evening champagne. Most comfortable size room for Europe. Still need to carry your own WASHCLOTHES. Concierge so helpful! Staff was remarkably attentive. Pub Kleber nearby and worth it! Minutes to Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Paris in September”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn S
Reviews.Content: One of the best vacations of my life! This hotel was perfect: small, quiet, clean comfortable rooms, convenient to Metro and sights and the staff was wonderful. My only complaint was the exercise room but I will definitely go back to this hotel next year when I plan to revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel with sub-par service”
Reviews.Author: Souris
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights Sept. 27 – Oct. 1 using Reward Points plus a supplementary fee of 140 Euros for our Junior Suite (Room 372). Check-in was fast and efficient, and the person who checked us in accompanied us to our room and showed us how to work everything. She was very warm and friendly, as was the bellhop who took care of our luggage. As Platinum Elite Members we were offered free internet and free breakfast (breakfast otherwise is billed at 27 Euros). The room was lovely in shades of gray, white and green. It was a large and very comfortable room with floor to ceiling window doors with a little balcony railing looking out over the courtyard garden restaurant. The room had a king bed with black leather bedskirt. The sitting area had a gray & green upholstered armchair; a gray sofa (pullout bed), and 2 small round cocktail tables. There was a large desk with a white leather chair. (It will be interesting to see how long that stays clean)! The lighting throughout was wonderful. The room had a long foyer with a door to close off the vestibule part. Off the foyer was a large 4-door armoire on one side and a WC and spacious bathroom on the other side. (A computer keyboard, fridge, Nespresso machine, tray with tea kettle, cups, etc. were housed behind one door of the armoire). The WC was very modern with a “bidet” hose. The bathroom had an enormous walk-in shower with rain shower head (not forceful enough for my taste) and a more forceful, excellent quality handheld hose that you could hang up and use as a showerhead. The sink had a lighted mirror. There was also a heated towel rack in the bathroom. For some reason, the shower cap, kleenex and cosmetic cotton pads were placed in the WC area – certainly an unsanitary place, especially for the kleenex as a toilet projects droplets over 600 ft. when flushed. Every time we moved the kleenex to the sink area, housekeeeping moved it back to the WC area! The restaurant in the hotel was very good (we had 3 meals here plus breakfast), although we found the service to be rather cold in the beginning. (It warmed up later during our stay). Still, the service in general was below par for this calibre of hotel. There were a lot of people working, but there simply didn’t appear to be enough time to properly attend to guests. (Example: they never asked if you wanted an aperitif, which is typical in any restaurant in France. Even if you did order one, it either didn’t come or it came a minute before your food was served). (Food costs: 2-course lunch for 2 with wine & aperitif was 125 Euros; 2-course lunch for one on another day with 1 glass of wine was 33 Euros; 2-course dinner for 2 with wine was 108 Euros). The bar service was incredibly bad. I almost had to beg to be served – yet there was no one else waiting to be served. I was sitting at a small table about 15 feet away from the bartender, and even after he brought drinks to the table directly next to me, I was ignored. I had to stare until I could catch his eye; and after 10 minutes of polishing glasses, the bartender finally looked up and asked from behind the bar if I wanted something. When I answered, “Yes,” he finally came over from behind the bar to take my order. Again, this is simply unacceptable service for this calibre of hotel. (Cost: 1 not very good Mojito was 14 Euros/US$19+). The concierge desk (there were 3 on duty) was always very helpful – no complaints here. Housekeeping, however, needs more training. One day we came back to the room to find a rainbow duster left on our luggage; wastebaskets not emptied; and, on a good note, finally, on the 3rd day of our stay, we “earned” 1 bathmat towel but never received one on any of the other 3 days. Once again, this is unacceptable for this quality of hotel. (It is rated 5-stars by the French Tourist Board). So, I’m giving the Décor an “A,” because it is a very lovely hotel, recently renovated, all is new and pristine. I’m giving it a “C” for service simply because it is a high-end hotel, and I think it should be friendlier, more competent, and more attentive for the price one pays here. (Compare to Renaissance Place Vendôme whose service is absolutely outstanding). For location, either an “A” or a “C” depending on how you view it. It is close to the Eiffel Tower, in a beautiful and safe part of Paris, in the posh 16th Arrondissement. It is also not terribly far from the Champs-Elysées. However, the hotel is not near the center of town, so it is not within easy walking distance of the Louvre, the Latin Quarter, and other points of interest further away. First-time tourists to Paris may prefer a more central location (such as the Marriott Place Vendôme). After all of this do I recommend it? Yes, absolutely, it is a beautiful hotel and I, personally, love the location and will definitely stay here again. I just hope that the management of this hotel finds a way to improve the bar & restaurant service as well as the housekeeping staff. Until then, it doesn’t merit its 5-star rating.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: jmichael11
Reviews.Content: This was a surprisingly nice little boutique hotel. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, and the feel of the place is very cozy. The courtyard is just gorgeous, and an extremely pleasant place to sit and have drinks. The rooms are rather small, but well appointed, and the beds are very comfortable. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: P-Lion007
Reviews.Content: My wife, one year old child and I stayed here and we couldn't ask for a nicer introduction stay in Paris. We didn't want to leave our room it was so nice. Pure luxury and comfort. The bed was very comfortable, the carpet plush and thick, the bathroom was immaculate and overall it was a nice quiet retreat after long days of sight seeing. Everything was new. The location was perfect for us as we were a very close walk to the Victor Hugo station and some amazing patisseries (still dreaming about the pastries). The hotel is also a short walk to the Arc du Triumph (to the north) and the Eiffel Tower (to the south). I would highly recommend this hotel. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property. Service lacking”
Reviews.Author: Gemstone4ever
Reviews.Content: The hotel is newly refurbished and looks very chic and the pretty courtyard looks very inviting. We were initially very pleased with our choice. Our room was tiny but we expected that. No complaints with the room - the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was luxurious. The problem with this hotel is the service which just mis-fires. Whoever has been to a 5 star hotel with a bar and no bar tender?! This was not an isolated problem as we stayed there for 4 nights. We would return home from touring for a nice glass of wine and sit patiently waiting for someone to notice us. One on occasion, after 20 mins, I walked into the restaurant to try and find someone to bring me a drink and they seemed annoyed that I was interrupting a busy dinner service. I just don't get it. It's so basic! The restaurant is very popular, especially on warm evenings, due to the lovely terrace. Good for them, but not good for guests who can't eat there because its fully booked throughout their stay and can't get any service as the staff are so busy in the dining room. So we didn't feel very welcome and, for the price, this is unacceptable, Also very annoying was the constant malfunctioning of the key. I saw other guests experiencing the same problem. The front desk never apologised, just kept giving us new keys. No we are not putting the keys by our mobiles, they just don't work properly! Nice area. I would stay in the 16th again, just not here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully Renovated Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fellowtraveller46
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four wonderful days in Paris before a 2 week cruise from Southampton this past August. Our hotel, Le Parc Trocadero, was perfectly situated between the Arc de Triomphe and the Trocadero which is across the Seine from the Eiffel Tower. Our small room was beautifully done, gorgeous bathroom, ample closet and shelf space for alot of clothing. The staff couldn't have been nicer or more accommodating. Well priced too! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Is New Better?”
Reviews.Author: pclemor
Reviews.Content: Our time there was enjoyable as usual thanks to the Concierge(s), the Bellmen, the Manager of the restaurant, all from the old guard but we really missed the old Second Empire feel which was sacrificed on the altar of modernization. In our old room a magic wand had transformed the window close to the bed in a tinted mirror which reflected a greenish cadaveric image of ours which we found a little premature in spite of our added age of 158 years....

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but bring your checkbook”
Reviews.Author: mangom
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a very nice safe location easy walk to the Arc or Eiffel Tower. It is in the Embassy district always safe and clean. The Metro Stop at Victor Hugo is 1/2 a block away. This is a VERY EXPENSIVE area. 4 nights here cost us $900+ with out breakfast. today the last morning we had the complete breakfast at $75 a couple. Lovely meal but $75 ? Paris is a great city but in the tourist areas the waiters and cab drivers are ruthless in their lack of honesty. Cabs never have change and waiters always insist on a tip even when the service is included. Our guide sent us to Les banquettes near the Bastile. The owner and his staff were pleasant , polite and generous in their effort to provide us with expert guidance , excellent service and an exceptional meal. We used the Metro every day. One day we squeezed into a car on line 1 at rush hour, a pickpocket robbed my wife and tried to rob me, but by a miracle the wallet was dropped and returned by a young boy to us. Unheard of in Paris that a pickpocket will get your wallet and you ever get it back. IN THE METRO BE VERY CAREFULL, the CITY is OVER RUN with Eastern European Thieves. Money belt, nothing in your pockets, and NEVER LET ANYONE INTO YOUR PERSONAL SPACE ON THE METRO. We loved our time in the City of Light. We met great people, admired the beatufull city, enjoyed exceptional food and wine, and had the homeymoon we never took 41 years ago. We will be back, but will leave our Pasports in the safe!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York City, New York, USA
Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Wonderful neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: NHM1991
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a beautiful neighborhood near the Eiffel Tower. Traveling with three teenagers so had two connecting rooms which were reasonably spacious with luxurious bathroom fittings and bedding. Hotel was a combination of low rise buildings with a central courtyard which was perfect for afternoon drinks or tea. Felt like a private club more than a hotel. Wonderful service. When we had trouble with the wi fi in one of the rooms they sent a technician up within minutes of our call. Location was perfect. Great neighborhood with lots of restaurants. Minutes walk to Le Trocadero, the Seine and the Eiffel Tower. Near the Metro as well. Wish we could have stayed longer, kids loved it too.

Reviews.Title: “More like a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmleesa
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and used our Marriott points for one room and realized we had to get another room for the children because rooms in Paris are VERY small and have one bed. Had to pay for the other room and it was pricey compared to what we usually would spend. I would not have paid for both rooms so the points helped. The rooms were connecting which was nice and very clean. Loved the little outdoor courtyard in the center of the two sections of the hotel where we would sit on sofas (could bring your own cocktails and snacks!) We did not eat in the restaurant for breakfast, but instead ate croissants at local bakeries or crepes at local cafes. It is a short walk to the Eiffle Tower in one direction and Victor Hugo area in the other direction. We even walked to the Arc de Triomphe. It is a quant hotel with a very attractive lobby and a somewhat helpful concierge. They loaned us huge umbrellas for when we were out, as well as the electrical outlet adapters. The only thing is both my hair iron and my daughters hair iron got fried and were forever damaged. I was not happy about that! They also had their own recommendations for tours and felt if I had trusted my own research I would have been better off. Also was disappointed that when we checked in very early they did not have our room ready and said to come back a little later which we did and it still was not ready so we had to hang out until it was and wasted a lot of the day. They didn't care that we were not pleased. It was more like a 4 star hotel, not a 5 star!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Pricey Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Italytravelgirl77382
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, great breakfast but watch out, very pricey if it isn't included in your room. Go down the street for something cheaper. It really isn't that close to the Eiffel Tower but you can walk, but there are tons of stairs to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: VCGadventures
Reviews.Content: This is my first review on trip advisor. I just want to say I spent two wonderful nights at this hotel. I did use my points built up from business travels. I had a wonderful room that was HUGE compared to any other hotel I have stayed in Europe. I had a king size bed along with a sitting area. The concierge was very helpful getting me places to see/eat. This may have been because I am a Platinum member (things that make you go hmmmm since this is a high end hotel.) Everyone should be treated the same (just saying). I did receive free breakfast which was 27 euro without the comp. which I personally think is expensive. Also internet was expensive (~20 euros) when I have been to less expensive hotels that give wireless internet for FREE not because you are a Platinum member!! The hotel is well decorated. I didn't have a courtyard view as my room was #312 it was good for me since I spent so little time in the room. Overall the location being near the Trocadero metro stop, and short walk to the Eiffel tower I would def. come back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect quiet and beautiful hotel in a safe area!”
Reviews.Author: straveladdict
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a family for 2 nights. The hotel is newly renovated and our room was lovely! It was a room that you would see in decorating magazines! Beautiful large king bed. All necessary amenities in the room. We had a lovely view of the courtyard. Courtyard is beautiful and quiet - a perfect place to relax, and such a rarity in Parisian hotels! Our room had power converter already so you don't need to bring your own. Breakfast was delicious! Pricey at 29 euros for a full buffet, but as a Gold member we got this for free. Pastries, breads, fruits, cereals, meats, eggs, coffees and speciality teas. Also, this hotel is in a very nice area (in the 16th arrondisement). Close to metro and quick walk to the most stunning view of the Eiffel Tower. Quiet, clean and safe area and hotel. Wished we could stay longer!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Angela60745
Reviews.Content: Had booked a king and a double room preferably connecting if possible. We were given a disabled room on one floor with and the children were on another floor in the double. Asked if this could be changed and was told this was not possible. Disabled room was old and did not have hairdryer or coffee maker. No atmosphere or character to this hotel. Wanted just a coffee in the morning could not get this without having to have breakfast, limited facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy modernized stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aburel
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, near Victor Hugo square and metro station, the hotel has a very modern but cosy look nowadays. Elegant, decent, clean and very comfortable. It has feb buildings around a nice comfy garden where you can relax after a long day in Paris. Breakfast was included, enough choices, presented in small quantities but sufficient and always available. If weather permits the nice gardens makes the croissant more tastefully. Rooms are ok for Paris and very comfortable. Nice surroundings and pleasant for both business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “A magic gem on a quiet street near metro stations”
Reviews.Author: wheretogonext1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was situated on a quiet street but very close to fabulous restaurants, the metro, and walking distance to Champs Elysee, Arc d'Triumph, and the Eiffel Tower. We actually walked much farther than that, but it was very easy to jump the metro and get to wherever you want to go. The staff is very kind and the concierge is quite helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, beautifully redecorated Marriott Renaissance property.”
Reviews.Author: MMADallas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the 16th Arrondisment and location to restaurants is excellent. Eiffel Tower is very close by as well as access to various forms of transportation. Great area for walking. The recently redecorated Le Parc Trocadero is lovely. Small attractive interior bar with beautiful, outside oasis setup with conversation areas for cocktails. The redecorated hotel is warm and inviting. Hotels rooms are pricey for their size so having the French courtyard was welcomed. Our room was so small that there was one way traffic in front of the bed! One stepped back if the other needed to get to the other side. I am sure there were larger rooms but I cannot report on them. All in all, we loved the location and the ambiance but were disppointed in room assignment. Gold was of no benefit there. We were not even provided with courtesy water even after they said they would.

Reviews.Title: “Twice as Nice”
Reviews.Author: cdhannah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice on our overall trip through France. We had the same great service both times. There are great restaurants near by and a small deli and convenience store a block away. Great location near a metro and neighborhood. Walking distance to major sights. Newly renovated and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room and location in the heart of Paris. Quiet and tranquil setting despite immediate access to Paris hotspots”
Reviews.Author: TravelingAllCreation
Reviews.Content: For benefit of providing ease of review, I highlight the key plusses and minuses: Plusses: 1] Very accessible to key Parisian sites. I love to walk, and getting to the Louvre, Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, and Champs-Elysse was definitely within walking distance if you have the time (you really explore the city that way). If time is of the essence, no problem because a subway stop is only a couple blocks away and can take you directly to those places. 2] Many of the rooms (including mine) overlook a large private patio and arboreal setting. This makes for a lovely view out the window and a quiet respite when returning from your travails out in the Paris sites. 3] Room was very comfortable and the bathroom was one of the best I have experienced in all of Europe. Lots of room and the shower was fantastic - stylish and roomy. 4] Lots of privacy. There were only 2 other rooms on my floor, so no hustle-bustle noise on the hall. Negatives: 1] It is pricey. 2] Rooms are not high enough to have a view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “I was very impressed with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: thefrequenttraveller
Reviews.Content: Booked this on marriott points and it was the only place I could get at the last minute. turns out to have been a lucky break. I really liked this hotel. It was small, very well located (only 10 minutes stroll to the Trocadero), next to a metro that went all the places we wanted to go to but was also quiet and in a 'real' part of paris. On top of that, this hotel had the best breakfast I have ever had in a Marriott (and as a platinum member - I tend to see a few!). Drinks can be a bit pricy (but so was everywhere else we went in Paris), but the courtyard in the summer was a pretty nice place to have a pre-dinner drink. I've only given 4 or 5 hotels 5 stars and I stay in hotels every week. I will go back to this one when next in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: retiredtravelwriter
Reviews.Content: The location is elegant and central, the hotel is delightful and the staff are friendly and helpful. We stay here every year and the biggest 'feelgood' attraction is the courtyard garden restaurant. Not too fancy, but a marvelous place to talk and relax. Rooms are excellent and the service consistently first class also. - Retired travel writer -

Reviews.Title: “A top notch hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jonmac55
Reviews.Content: Room was very nice.. The comp'd breakfast was very good. There are so many choices of shops and restaurants in the area we did not eat dinner here. Excellent wifi. 3 metro lines within 2 short blocks along with a great carafe point for the eiffel tower

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Kathykoer
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here in May, 2011. The hotel was completely renovated, and everything is fresh, new and bright. When we were there, they were still working out a few glitches, but nothing terrible. The staff were helpful, although they seemed a bit short-staffed at times. The room was roomy for Paris standards. Breakfast was expensive, but offered a great variety and plenty of food. The location is fantastic ... a short walk to the Trocadero, Eiffel Tower, and the Seine. It sits in a fairly residential, up-scale neighborhood, so there wasn't large numbers of tourists, Metro stations were nearby, and there were plenty of local cafes and restaurants to visit. It is on the opposite side of the city from Charles de Gaulle airport ... so getting to and from the airport took a little time ... but we had a nice tour of the city while getting there. The staff spoke English ... some better than others ... and they all humored me with my attempts at speaking French. We did not want for anything while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice modern renovated hotel in chic location”
Reviews.Author: Bryceadvisor
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night for a business function and have stayed before a couple of times and at a couple of the other Renaissances in Paris. The hotel has been renovated (rooms + courtyard + lobby/ bar) and is massively improved and modernised from what it was before, it really feels like a proper luxury hotel now. I enjoyed the 'park' detailing in the room. The staff seem to have taken a refresher course in manners and politeness as all seemed very eager and helpful. I didn't eat in the restaurant but looked smart, especially the outdoors heated eating area. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Newly Renovated and worth fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: bookcruises
Reviews.Content: Incredibly renovated boutique hotel. Hotel reopened in May after extensive renovation. Standard room was small by US standards but very well laid out and big enough for a European Queen bed (between a queen and king by US/standards). Bathroom large and well laid out. Service was great from the moment we checked in - we were even escorted to our room by the front desk staffer! The hotel is 4 small 3-4 story buildings tied together by a center courtyard. Restaurant and small bar onsite. Concierge,Bellman,doorman also on site. Hotel is typical expensive nickel and dime European hotel. €20-€30 breakfast. €20 daily internet access. Expensive bar drinks. Location is a quiet neighborhood with Trocadero/Eiffel tower and Champs de Ellysesless than a mile away in opposite directions. Small market and small deli only 1 block away. Several small restaurants nearby, fair pricing. Taxi is €10-€20 to most locations. Metro also nearby. Great value at about €200 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fresh and clean”
Reviews.Author: Tomplu
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week in paris. This hotel is ideally located walking distance to two different Metro lines. The hotel is in a nice neighborhood close to the Trocadero and a 15 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. The room and bath are a good size by european standards and very clean and stylish. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We had the included breakfast every morning which we thought was expensive until we stopped for a break at a cafe and paid 6 euro for a coffee! We didn't have lunch or dinner at the hotel as we were out sightseeing all day and went out for dinner afterward. Our room had a view to the courtyard which is nicely landscaped and has patio seating. The staff are all French speaking and were very patient when we used our high school French on them. They quickly switched to English when they could tell we were out of our depth. I'm not sure why other reviewers were so negative, we had a pleasant experience during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Quiet Location - Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: bububub
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this newly renovated room in May. It was a great trip and the hotel was very nice - great value for money considering Prices in Paris. We really liked the renovated rooms - very chic - and the location was nice and quiet and not so touristy - couple of minutes walk to Metro at Victor Hugo. Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Ok Stay , Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: kishore_vaddipalle
Reviews.Content: The Hotel staff was good , It's in a prime location which is very good , But the room was small and felt little congested. Also there was this annoying cleaning lady disturbing the whole day , asking when will we leave the room for cleaning , doesn't deserve a 5 * for this kind of behavior.

Reviews.Title: “Small boutique hotel near Eiffel Tower delivers great experience”
Reviews.Author: HPM1984
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Paris Le Parc Tracadero Hotel is just two minute walk from the Eiffel Tower and a twenty minute stroll to the Arc De Triump. I arrived at 730 am (after a flight from Boston) to the hotel having alerted them to my early arrival. The reception host was very welcoming with my room ready to check in and a recommendation for a place to have coffee (to the right a two minute walk to the circle). My room was probably 12 square meters, perhaps (150 square feet) small but pretty standard for Paris. i was meeting four other colleagues for business and we had negotiated a decent rate 310 euros for Sunday and 400 Euros for MON- THU. Not to bad also by Paris standards- plus with our Elite Marriott Status (all of us) they provided full breakfast every day. Not inexpensive of course- but then this IS Paris. The room was cozy and well equipped with a small table/desk in between the television bureau (with storage area for clothes. Very quiet even though it overlooked the courtyard (in a separate building less than 30 feet across the courtyard from reception. Very nice overall and dark at nice with solid curtains that could be drawn revealing light silk shades that let in sun. As I always do upon arriving after a Transatlantic Flight I hit the health club (knee problems preventing me from running regularly). This was an immediate disappointment- it had a strange elliptical machine (serviceable but cranky) a stationary bike and a cheap and basic treadmills. Also an exercise ball and a set of dumbells no heavier than 15 pounds is my guess. Not in the class with the usual Marriott Health Clubs in Europe. The courtyard was the highlite for our party- after working and prior to dinner we would sit on comfortable couches (wicker with cushions) and chairs and enjoy conversation prior to and after dinner. The staff was excellent and always ready with drinks and the bill when it was needed. The gardening in the courtyard is superb and it is a beautiful oasis with access from the hotel and through a iron gated entrance way. Breakfast was fine with continental (bread & croissants & fruit/yogurt) or a full breakfast with whiting, salmon and bacon and eggs cooked to order. WE had dinner one night (after an especially long day) at the restaurant- a very limited menu with hamburgers, pasta etc. Nice but limited offset by the fact you can eat in the courtyard which is a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully redesigned hotel - with superb service!”
Reviews.Author: jbr613
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for four nights in April 2011. The hotel had just been refurbished and the room were lovely. The rear garden and patio had not yet been completed, but I would expect that they would be by now. Even more extraordinary, however, was the level of service. We had a couple of pretty significant travel glitches (lost daypack, lost passport) and the staff could not have been more helpful. Everyone at the front desk, the concierge and the security staff were unbelievably attentive - for any city, let alone Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel but not 5 star caliber”
Reviews.Author: M&ADallas
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, charming and romantic. Our room was recently renovated. The bathroom had some serious functional issues (i.e. no shower door so water got everywhere after showing and the faucet was placed too far back from bowl so water got all over the sink counter during use). The room was decently spacious for Paris. Also, the updates were seemingly luxurious. The linens were freshly changed, white, clean and inviting. It was cozy and romantic. We walked through a small courtyard to get to our rooms which makes the hotel seem like a boutique. This can be a pro or con depending on your tastes. Everyone who worked here spoke English but it was very shaky English as if they memorized certain phrases. They had trouble truly communicating with us. Also, the service was not that of a 5 star hotel. The concierge was not helpful whatsoever which was the most disappointing of all. The location was great and close to three metro (subway) stops which was nice. It was very close to cafes that had a wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower. They had an American breakfast for 27 euros but we didn't eat there. How outrageous! Go to a nice cafe 4 blocks south with a view of the Eiffel Tower for much less! We used points for our stay; therefore, we didn't pay anything to stay here. I looked at the hotel rates online, and they seemed quite high for what you get. The reason I booked here was for good, American service but I did not receive that kind of service. I might as well have stayed at a 5 star French hotel with a better, more central location for what it costs at this hotel if I were paying cash rather than using points. Bottom line is really that I'm undecided. It was nice and there were no surprises other than possibly the fact that the concierge was not helpful. If I visit Paris again and cannot use my Marriott reward points, I won't be staying here. If I have enough points for free nights, I might be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great if You Can Book with a Promotional Cost”
Reviews.Author: JulesfromIowa
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Paris - always a favorite. We stayed at the Renaissance knowing full well that it is undergoing renovation. The price was good - a promotional price through Marriott. Do NOT even think about eating breakfast at the hotel. Ridiculous price for breakfast. I am not sure what is going on with the European Marriotts with their breakfast prices. There is no excuse for charging a hotel guest $35 (once you do the conversion) for a buffet of runny eggs and soggy bacon. Go down the street to the square and give your hard-earned money to the local cafe and get a fab breakfast for 1/3 the cost. This is my biggest beef with the hotel. Along with the price of wi-fi. The cafe down the street has free wi-fi. Someday Marriott is going to get the message about wireless costs. While they are not quite ready to prove the five stars, the staff is proud of their makeover. And with good reason. It still smells like paint, varnish or saw dust but I'm not in the room much. Work and drilling starts early so be prepared to be up and about by 8AM. But hey, you are not in Paris to sleep the day away are you? The beds are great. Linens are good. Turn down service is available (but kinda creepy). The location is perfect. I don't know why someone here said it's not good for a walking tour of Paris because you are only 2 streets from the best view of the Eiffel Tower; half a street from the Metro that takes you anywhere; around the corner from several great bakeries; a quick taxis ride to the most famous street in the world the Champs-Élysées. It's not an inexpensive hotel and you may not find the value but it is a guaranteed spotless room, near the sights with an awesome staff who love to speak to you in either English or French. I highly suggest you give your French a try. You will surely get a smile in return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic but short stay”
Reviews.Author: Lothar072
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just a single night (for my Birthday) while most of our stay was in the south of France. With that said, it was fantastic. We got there somewhat early so we weren't able to check in right away. They stored our bag while we walked to the Eiffel Tower and out for lunch. There is plenty of food choices just a block or two down. When we returned we had a quick cocktail in the lobby (still had to wait just a little longer to check in but it was still early). When we did check in, they had given us a nice room with a loft on the second floor. It was very clean and fairly spacious considering it's location. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was great. Just a short walk to both the Eiffel Tower and Arc De Triomphe. I wish we would have been able to stay longer but I would certainly recommend it from what we did see.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place but TERRIBLE service.”
Reviews.Author: KMPeterson
Reviews.Content: We arrived late from London but had notified them ahead of time, guaranteeing the room with a credit card, and at the same time asking for extra towels. The extra towels were because we knew we'd be hot and sweaty after traveling and would want to shower before bed and not have wet towels in the morning. The room we were given had no extra towels, had a queen bed even though our reservation said a king was guaranteed, and was too hot with windows that can't be opened more than a crack. The A/C wasn't powerful enough too cool it either. When we asked for a different room, twice, the first time politely, the second the next morning and a bit angrily,the staff expressed little sympathy. Only asking to make it up by giving us a free breakfast - which was already included in our room rate!! To be fair, they did say they could get us to a king bed room after 2 nights of our planned 4 night stay. When we spoke to the hotel manager about our disappointment, also mentioning the email exchange with the concierge I'll summarize below, she barely offered any sympathy and didn't offer anything to make up for the poor experience so far. Not a discount, room upgrade, free meal, free internet, free TV movie, nothing. Yes, I can ask for this but I expect a quality hotel to offer it. Other places have. The email exchange with the concierge I mentioned above was that they emailed us a week before our stay to ask if there was anything he could do for us in advance. He specificly mentioned reservations at the hotel restaurant. My wife responded immediately with a request for reservations only to be told that the restaurant wasn't open yet for dinner! Why ask us if we need reservations in the first place then? By the way, while we were in the lobby for 30m having our discussion with staff, at least two other guests came down and complained about how hot their room was last night. At least the room is clean and the hotels location is good, but this place is run rather poorly.

Reviews.Title: “Some re-opening hiccups but otherwise a lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: scruffsmcduff
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Paris Hotel Le Parc Trocadero with my two teenage children for five days in early April. Our room was a triple and located in the main building just above the lobby. Overall, our stay was wonderful although we were very disappointed that the renovations were far from complete when we checked in. With the exception of the breakfast room, no other areas of the hotel were open although the lobby bar was near completion when we checked out. Our room smelled like fresh paint for the first couple of days and the fire alarms went off early morning two days in a row. Other than the re-opening hiccups our stay was wonderful. The hotel staff was courteous, always eager to help and very welcoming with broad smiles whenever we entered or exited the hotel. The hote front deskl manager was extremely professional and it is apparent that she understands how to take care of her customers. The continental breakfast was good and the wait staff very friendly and eager to please.. The location in the lovely Trocadero neighborhood is extremely convenient to everything with the metro just two blocks from the hotel. The view of the Eiffel Tower from the nautical museum (also two blocks away) is the best of anywhere in Paris and be sure to catch the site at night when the Tower "twinkles" on the hour every hour until midnight. I am sure that once the re-opening hiccups are sorted out, that this will become my favorite home away from home in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “An almost perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: iriegirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here as a part of a 3-city European trip to celebrate our anniversary. It was our first time in Paris and we were not disappointed. The renovation was still ongoing, but what had been completed was gorgeous. The decor is impeccable, the room was very comfortable and the color scheme throughout the hotel was very soothing. Even though there were some kinks that still needed to be worked out, the hotel staff couldn't have been more accommodating in trying to find workaround solutions until things were back to normal. As Marriott Rewards Gold members, breakfast was complimentary to us. It would really have been lovely to have breakfast out in the courtyard, but it wasn't finished yet. I'm sure that, like everything else, it will be done quite beautifully. This hotel really is in a fabulous location. As first-timers to Paris, who speak no French, we were worried about getting around the city and interacting with the locals. This hotel is a 5min walk from the Victor Hugo Metro station, and also in a very central location to visit the Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triomphe, and Champs Elysees. It was also a quick Metro ride from the Tuileries Gardens, the Louvre and various other tourist attractions. All of the patisserie/brasserie/street food vendors we encountered spoke English, which was a great relief (especially since we forgot our French phrasebook here at home). All in all, our stay at this hotel helped to make our first visit to Paris (and Europe itself) a perfect anniversary trip. It's definitely one that we'll consider revisiting on our next trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and soooo comfortable”
Reviews.Author: didoshi
Reviews.Content: The staff was remarkably helpful, friendly and gracious. There wasn't a request that we made that wasn't immediately fulfilled. The bed was so comfortable that we had a difficult time waking up each morning and getting out of the room. The remodel is gorgeous, with plush contemporary decorations and fully appointed rooms. Wish the garden was completed as it will be beautiful. As a Marriott Platinum Elite member, the welcome was even more outstanding. Because of the status we had a number of additional amenities for free: WiFi, continental breakfast (regualrly 26 Euro per person) and a fabulous welcome gift of chocolates, wine and a cheese plate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SGEverettWA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located in central Paris. A 10 minute walk to Le Trocadero and the Eiffel Tower, a 15 minute walk to the Arch de Triumphe. Rooms were small but very clean, oddly enough the bathroom was quite roomy. We did have a view of the Eiffel Tower though. Staff was extremely helpful and courteous. Would not recommend eating at the hotel simply because it is very expensive. Very good restaurants close by and a Starbucks and delicious boulangerie 5 minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointingly neglected - used to be a wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: electroshock
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Parc on several occasions years ago and always returned. The rooms were immaculate, the decor very sophisticated, the service outstanding and the restaurant superb. Since being taken over by Renaissance it has been sadly neglected, is shabby and is a pale shadow of its former self. For these proces you can find much better hotels in Paris. I won't be returning

Reviews.Title: “Not a great location for walking Paris”
Reviews.Author: Foxtripper
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quiet, clean, comfortable and the staff was helpful but the location was not one I would suggest if you like to walk to the city attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: christinefripp
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful surprise this hotel was! We stayed on Points and were not expecting much....thought it would be just another chain.....TOTALLY WRONG! The staff was BEYOND helpful....really helped us negotiate a city we had never visited before. The location is perfect! Great cafes and restaurants with a 5 minute walk but still very quiet neighborhood. The Metro is right down the street and the Eiffel Tower is just a few blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Not just one American in Paris”
Reviews.Author: joaozinho
Reviews.Content: We appeared to be the only non-Americans staying at the Renaissance that weekend in September. I suspect a lot of them were doing the same as me and using up their Marriott points there. It meant that the building which looked suitably Parisian from outside, if somewhat Disneyfied once into the courtyard, felt like a suburb of Detroit. All these transatlantic friends probably didn’t put the French staff in the best of moods, especially the concierges who were distinctly laissez-faire. The receptionists were much friendlier. We were put in a small, dark room at the bottom of a light shaft at the back of the hotel. Typically tiny as most Parisian hotel rooms seem to be. The room was clean and looked recently renovated, if, again, a somewhat Disneyesque imagination of what a French room should look like. The cleanliness stopped dead when we got to the urine sprayed toilet seat. Call me old fashioned but removing human waste should be something of a priority when it comes to room cleaning – I’d even forgo the chocolate on my pillow to avoid other people’s.….(running out of polite words that won’t get this entry deleted). While we were out they sent someone to clean it but no apology was offered. Top tip – avoid the soulless bar. Even the barman didn’t want to hang out there and he was getting paid for it. We eventually found him after about 10 minutes where upon he charged us 27 euros for 2 drinks. There are some nice cafés half a block up on Victor Hugo square where we would have gone if it hadn’t been raining so hard. Also a fantastic patisserie for sandwiches and petit tarte de chocolat.

Reviews.Title: “A historic building, conveniently located near the Trocadero”
Reviews.Author: thnarf
Reviews.Content: Earlier this month I stayed at the Renaissance Paris Le Parc Trocadero for a 2 night reward stay over the weekend. I put a video together of the room. So if you’d like to *see* what the hotel and room look like, check it out here: http://yelloww.net/blog/2010/10/ren-trocadero/ The hotel is convientently located near the Eifel Tower, in between the Trocadero and Victor Hugo metro stops. From the hotel it is about a 5 minute walk to either station. The Arc de Triomphe is also near by, and is about a 15 minute walk from the hotel. Another nice feature of this neighborhood is that there is a small grocery store just two blocks away that is a great place to stock up on bottled water and fruit. The hotel is comprised of multiple buildings, situated around an outdoor courtyard. Upon arriving at the hotel, the bell-hop immediately took our luggage, and directed us to the check-in counter. We arrived at 12pm, and were informed that our room was not yet ready, but would be ready by 3pm. I’ve been to Paris a few times now, and am quite used to not being able to check in early, so this wasn’t a big deal. A nice touch was that the hotel offered to take my cell phone number, and call once our room was ready. The bell-hop stored our bags away, and we went off to be tourists in Paris. Upon returning to the hotel in the evening and finally checking in, we were informed that our bags were already in the room, and that to get there we had to go “outside” and then to the building called “La Residence.” It seemed complicated at first, but the bell-boy showed us the way and it really wasn’t a big deal. The room itself was quite comfortable. Bigger in size than a typical Paris hotel room. We had a room with two twin beds, a flat panel LCD television, a mini bar/refrigerator, and a small desk. Our room overlooked the courtyard, and was very quiet. We didn’t hear any other guests, or noise from the courtyard. Two things that I really appreciated about the room is that the air conditioning worked very well and ice is available on request. Overall the room was very nice — but the two negative points are: 1) A lack of available power outlets — to plug in my laptop I needed to unplug the desk lamp. 2) The shower faucet head was just plain weird — it’s an old shower head, and the head kept falling off from the hose portion. The hotel does not have a concierge lounge, but Platinum and Gold Marriott members recieve free breakfast in the restaurant 7 days a week, which is a really good deal since the breakfast is normally 27 euro. The breakfast is a full American breakfast with waffles, pancakes, eggs, sausage, pastries, fruits, yogurt and cereal. Definitely the best breakfast I’ve had in Paris. In the morning, complimentary coffee is also available in the hotel lobby for all guests. The hotel does have a small fitness center that has an eliptical machine, treadmill, and bicycle — one of each. Overall I would highly reccomend this hotel to other travellers to Paris. It has very nice amenities, and because it is in a historic building it doesn’t feel like “just another Marriott.”

Reviews.Title: “We were so pleased with chose this hotel”
Reviews.Author: pepperfgp
Reviews.Content: The staff members were all very helpful and friendly. From the doorman upon check-in to the bell-hop at check-out. Great location! Its close to the metro, many cafes and you can walk to the Eiffel. We were able to see the light show from our room. The rooms were spacious and very clean. There is a beautiful garden courtyard which serves breakfast, lunch, dinner or just coctails. The hotel has a bar . It' s small and indoors, but were a group of eight and had so much fun with the bartender the last night of our stay. What we liked best... it was all good. Least... the rate is a bit high when you take into account the exchange rate from US dollars to Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Most overrated expensive attitude trap in the world”
Reviews.Author: Scubahunk2
Reviews.Content: For a US$450.00-a-night supposedly 5-star hotel, the service level is at best 3 star! I don't know who's imagination Joserf and Edward and all the other angels of excellent service mentioned in previous reviews live. Three times now I've stayed at this hotel because it is designated as a corporate hotel for a client. Every stay there's a service issue. Front desk staff is passive-aggressive and full of attitude. Simple service requests were politely acknowledged but never carried through without two or three reminders. For example, my in-coming phone line only rings in the bathroom phone set and not on the desk phone set. Two requests later, the problem is still here with no messages of follow-up from anyone. The concierge staff is condesending and makes me feel like i'm imposing on their time. The restaurant staff makes me feel like I'm visiting for the first time no matter how many times you've dined with them at the same time with the same service staff over a few consecutive days during my stay. The only friendly and helpful staff members are the doormen, bellmen and the catering staff servicing the meeting rooms. For the money I paid, it is definitely highway-robbery.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Chap-resident
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights as part of a 2 week 20th anniversary France vacation. We are from NY, so we understand city space limitations. I booked a suite, which was a loft, with tye bedroom and bed upstairs. It was very quiet since we faced a courtyard. Internet was an extra charge, small gym was nice. Joseph, the head concierge made some good restaueant choices. I emailed him a week before our arrival to make restaurant reservations, since you really do need them in Paris. Valentina was very attentive and sent cream to our room for our coffee. The breakfast buffet was good foodwise. We had the breakfast 5 times at 54 euros for the 2 of us. But, my wife loved it, and the convenience, before a long site seeing day. Hey, it was our 20th anniversary. The Victor Hugo stop on the number 2 metro was close. It was an easy walk to the Eiffel Tower. In summary, good location, quiet, friendly, small gym, good breakfast (not cheap). We had had chocolates with turn down service, and a bottle of wine for our anniversary. I paid 80 euros to have roses and a bottle of champagne in our room priior to arrival, to suprise my wife. I can't comment on the hotel restaurant for dinner, since we never had it, though it looked good. I stuckwith my pre planned reservstions.

Reviews.Title: “A cozy place away from home with great hospitality from Edgar and Josef”
Reviews.Author: TWAflyer
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of its location and good reviews from Trip Advisor. Upon check-in, Edgar welcomed us with a big smile and an engaging efficiency. Our room was quite cozy with big windows looking into a quiet courtyard.. The next few days, Josef the concierge helped us with our planed sightseeing of the city with great humor. What we found was that the hotel is in the vicinity of the metro station (Place de Victor Hugo), Place de Trocadero, a great view of the Eifel Tower day and night, and many shops and restaurants inclding the Rue de Longchamp. We felt very safe in the hotel (one entrance/exit) and,that said, had a fabulous time in Paris. ( Two ladies in Paris)

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding room with a great view of The Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: Dorfer
Reviews.Content: My fiancée and I arrived at The Renaissance Paris Hotel Le Parc Trocadero after spending a few weeks in Spain and Italy. As a Marriott Gold Reward Member, I contacted the hotel a few days before our arrival through their e-concierge and let them know we had become engaged on our trip. We arrived late in the evening and were immediately upgraded to a suite room (I had booked a superior room using points) with an amazing view of the The Eiffel Tower plus chocolates and a bottle of Piper-Heidsieck Champagne waiting in the room. The hotel also offered us a great deal on a price-fixed dinner at the hotels restaurant (Le Relais du Parc) and complimentary bottle of wine with dinner as a congratulations gift. As we were tired, we accepted although we normally skip hotel restaurants. The restaurant was busy, but they somehow got us seated the minute we got off the elevator. The food and service was actually very good and the free bottle of wine made dinner very affordable! Our room was very nice with a great view, king size bed, LCD TV, large bathroom, and all of the other amenities you would expect at a Marriott hotel. The ceiling was a little dusty, but otherwise the room was very clean and well maintained. We had the complimentary hotel breakfast for Marriott Gold Members, which was served in the regular breakfast buffet (there is no lounge). French croissants and plenty of other american breakfast options, including fresh fruit. The hotel is centrally located and we walked all over Paris. We found a couple of great restaurants around the hotel and plenty of shopping options. Overall, we had a great stay at the hotel and will always remember how they treated us on our engagement trip. Hotels should pay attention to special occasions and events. The Renaissance Paris Hotel Le Parc Trocadero has earned a customer and we'll be back for anniversaries or other tips to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: epicentre666
Reviews.Content: Our 2 night stay at the Renaissance Hotel Le Parc Trocadero left a lot to be desired from the front desk staff. The front desk was rude and unattentive both during check in and check out. Granted we were among many others waiting to check in early but the lack of attention and courtesy was surprising. The breakfast buffet was typical of Marriot hotels in the US as seemed the general atmosphere and guests staying there. The suite was courtyard facing, huge, beautiful and very quiet. The only negative was that the water drained very slowly in the bathroom. On check out, the woman at the front desk gave us some attitude about removing an additional bottled water from our bill. Very unnessary and unprofessional. After what we spent on the suite, did she think we wanted to get away with a free bottle of water? We will not be coming back here.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel not geared to the businessman”
Reviews.Author: ratcher
