Reviews.Content: The positives - great location, nice rooms, quiet off the street, helpful staff. Seemed very popular location for upper crust locals to gather. One block to subway; lots of restaurants in the area. If this were a pleasure trip, I would have been much more satisfied. The negatives - crawling under the desk to unplug the lamp to use the only plug for my computer, others had no plug near the desk; poor lighting for reading for work; very expensive services (1 euro to stamp and mail postcards, car service was nearly triple a cab for airport, internet access from room); eggs at breakfast that tasted like powdered mix; very expensive bar (the deal of the day was 9 euro for a "pint" of heineken in an unmarked glass; bath tub with six inch wing to keep shower water off the floor; maids who turned off power in the room which drained the batteries of computer and phone that were charging; and relatively expensive. I expect more from Renaissance brand hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to Eiffel Tower, Nice Staff, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kris10UK
Reviews.Content: The thing I liked about this hotel was that, it was literally a 5 minute walk to the Trocadero, which is basically right at the Eiffel Tower! On our first day in, my family and I walked right down the street and then it was like, WOAH, the eiffel tower! It was very neat. There are nice cafes near by too. The hotel and room were very clean, and the location of the rooms is not street side, which is nice for the noise. The staff were also welcoming, many of them speaking fluent english. We were worried about the language barrier, but it turned out good. The Renaissance is also about a 15 minute walk to all the best shopping in Paris, the Champs de Elysses.

Reviews.Title: “Charm of Paris”
Reviews.Author: chuprasov
Reviews.Content: We were staying at this hotel for the second time. When we decided to go to Paris we did not even hesitate about hotel. Very nice property. Lonely, cozy, quiet hotel in the city centre, five minutes of walking from Tour d'Eiffel and the Champs Elysée. In the hotel there is simply perfect court yard where breakfast is served in the summer time. Rooms are very small, however as far as I understand this is very typical for Paris. I would recommend his hotel first of all for romantic travelers, and also for business and travel for the shopping-tour. There is a nice restaurant where guests have their dinner, followed by glass of Rose in the bar. However for breakfast I would advise to walk 300 meters to the Trocadero square with cafes having the century history – Kleber, Malakoff, Café du Trocadero. To have breakfast with the view on the Eiffel Tower – it is a really pleasant

Reviews.Title: “sstaying in this hotel was a completely satisfying experience in every way.”
Reviews.Author: MommomZ
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I came to Paris to visit my grandson, studying for his 'semester abroad" at the Sorbonne. Our choice was led by 2 things..the quality of the hotel and it's location, and a marvelous promotion that made the price more tempting. Our accomodations were superior, the service was excellent, the beauty of the hotel made it feel like we were truly in a very unique and wonderful place. The room service breakfast was a bit pricey, but more than adequate and i regret that we didn't take advantage of the hotel restaurant which is a real winner as we were told. I would not consider another hotel were I to return to Paris in the future. M. Zucker

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Service, will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Sleeping_Beauty_Me
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before deciding on this hotel. My boyfriend and I decided to take a last minute trip to Paris in 2009 and we got a great deal. We arrived at the hotel exhausted and were greeted by a very lovely lady at the front desk. She upgraded our room, which was very roomy (even by American standards), clean and nicey decorated. It was definitely more than I expected! I really enjoyed the location, it seemed a little more residential and very safe. We encountered so many lovely Parisians who put up with our horrible French! Although the hotel is a little bit off the beaten path we could walk to the eiffel tower, and the metro is close by. At night we'd walk to the Haagen-Daz for desert, and listen to the beautiful accents. When I go back to Paris I will certainly stay here again, it's so good I almost want to keep it a secret!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dgm_kent
Reviews.Content: Came to stay here in November of 2009 for a long weekend (and as it turns out to get engaged!) and had a wonderful time. We didn't spend much time in the hotel but the room was comfortable and clean. It wasn't the most modern of rooms, however it was a very good size and overlooked the courtyard which is very picturesque (and away from the noise of the road at the front of the hotel) The only disappointment is that we didn't get to eat a single meal at the hotel. The one night we fancied eating at the hotel restaurant turned out to be the one night in Paris when everything is shut - Sunday! The location of the hotel is a 10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower, and a 20 minute walk to Arc D'Triomphe. Lots of options for the underground surrounding the area as well. Hotel was very quiet, but staff were helpful and room was always clean, with a choccy on the pillow waiting for us every night when we got back to our rooms! One flaw - only one dressing gown in the room. I found this very odd indeed. Surely 2 or none, but 1?! Very strange. To summarise, the hotel was good, served our needs, but not amazing. Despite this it worked well as a base for lots of sightseeing, and the beds gave us a restful night.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Paris”
Reviews.Author: BarbM2015
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for the first time in February 2010. I was a little nervous based on other reviews about the noise and the quality of the rooms. Our room was great! Had charm and ample space (of course, not by U.S. standards). Yes, the shower can flood the bathroom if you're not careful, but it's not hard to keep the water inside. The staff was fabulous. The concierges were very helpful in making reservations for us, and making suggestions for dinner. The Trocadero district is a little off the beaten path as far as tourists go. Most of the bars and cafes have more locals than tourists in them. The Metro station is right down the street so you can get anywhere in the city. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Something Very Special”
Reviews.Author: shilyl
Reviews.Content: Traveling on my own i was worried as to what to expect, Didnt take long to feel a very special feeling of being welcome and well cared for. The Hotel is well present modern & chic with Splendour and design. Rooms are comfy and relaxing looking out onto Avenue Poincare, I was only on a Bed & Breakfast basis, but was delighted to try the fresh abundance of food each morning, Fresh croisants, cheese & meat and delightful fresh fruits & jams & yoghurts.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Boopers
Reviews.Content: Our room was modern, clean, new furniture, new light fixtures, everything looked to be brand new. The bedding was very comfortable and we slept great. We did not experience any noise issues. The bathroom had two bathrobes, lots of space under the sink for storage, and bathtub/shower combination. There were many cafes and bakeries within minutes of the hotel. In addition, there was a 7-11 type store a block from the hotel front door. It was open 24 hours and had sodas, beer, wine, snacks, cookies, fruit, and much, much more. The neighborhood was just that - a neighborhood. Children were coming home from school, people were shopping in butcher shops, nothing like the other more tourist areas of Paris. The Trocadero metro was a few minutes walk and from this point there was an excellent view of the Eiffel Tower. We had a weekend special rate - 3 nights for the price of 2. The rooms are larger than most Paris hotels. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: ERT786
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Location was close to Eiffel Tower only problem was the noise, It seems as if the walls are made of cardboard could actually hear the wake up call of the neighbouring room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice staff, fairly clean but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Babenoname
Reviews.Content: Perhaps I expected too much of the Renaissance name but this is certainly not a 4* hotel. I've traveled Europe for years but somehow have never noticed the quality of hotels being at least a * under that of American hotels. This hotel was in a decent location, quiet street during the night - it was clean, comfy and nice but just missing those extras you expect from 4*. One thing did impress me, the Alain Ducasse restaurant in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: NYC_8888
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel within 10-15 mins walk to the Eiffel Tower, Champs Elysee, Arc d'Triomphe and Seine River cruises. The hotel is centered around a pretty courtyard and the rooms are a nice combination of classic and modern. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Don't miss the Alain Ducasse restaurant at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another Renaissance "Boutique" Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: smccoyphd
Reviews.Content: I love the Marriott for having this brand under their umbrella. I can always depend that a Renaissance hotel in Europe and older American cities be in unique (usually converted old) properties in terrific locations--this one is no exception. It is in a "hotel particulaire" of Albert Nobel in a upscale, quiet neighborhood near the Eiffel Tower and the Arc de Triomphe. Metro stop Victor Hugo is a 4 minute walk away and Trocadero is 7 minutes. The concierge service took care of everything we needed-- restaurant recommendations, reservations, taxi service, etc. (Our one concierge, Pascal, even walked us to a neighborhood restaurant -- he thought it would be easier to show us than explain it to us!) Our room (#120) was spacious (especially for Paris) and the decor elegant with the delicious Marriott bedding. The closet space and built -in cabinets were extremely usable especially for a week's stay. Our wall of windows overlooked the beautiful courtyard (restaurant in good weather) which was surrounded by gardens and a Chateau looking tower. Housekeeping was excellent and accommodating to our schedule. Room service (for ice) was immediate,--we no sooner hung up the phone but someone was at the door with it. While the resident restaurant "Relais du Parc" was created by Alain Ducasse, we didn't sample dinner there. Breakfast (included in our room rate for the stay with Marriott points) was varied and excellent--both buffet and a la carte. This hotel made my fifth stay in Paris as memorable as the first!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: livestotravel-7
Reviews.Content: Our trip dates were 10/5/09-10/10/09. Our room was paid for by our Marriott points. Our room was in the back building - "the residence". The room was small as expected. The room was not very clean. All around the edges of the carpet were dusty and obviously not cleaned in some time. The furniture was old and because of that seemed unclean. The king bed was two twins pushed together and made with separate sheets. The bathroom was poorly lit. The hairdryer provided didn't work. When I requested a new one it was brought promptly. Perhaps we may have just had a bad room. I didn't see any others. I am sorry I did not ask the first night if they had anything better. Live and learn....

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded to 7th floor Suite”
Reviews.Author: IlliniRon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on business in Paris and was really impressed with the hotel. They upgraded me to a really nice suite on the top floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower out the window. Location is great for seeing the city, and it's a very quiet neighborhood. Breakfast was very good quality and staff helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything great, everyone helpful.”
Reviews.Author: psfl
Reviews.Content: Great location, staff always helpful and had answers for everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Bad Room”
Reviews.Author: clickums
Reviews.Content: I'm really torn about this review. The Renaissance Hotel is in a great location. It was a short walk (15 mins) down from the Arc de Triomphe, past wonderful clothing shops and eateries. Upon arriving we were exhausted and had requested an early check in. The front desk made a FANTASTIC effort to get us whisked off to our room (rm 182). The room was spacious by European standards and very clean. The problem didn't start until later. The walls in this place are paper thin. We could actually hear every single conversation and foot fall from the people above us. The guests overhead would get in from partying around 2am. Walk back and forth. Talk. You could even hear them using the bathroom. For a person who suffers from mild insomnia already - it was impossible for my to sleep for more than hour in this place. And lastly, just one more minor complaint. When we first arrived we had to ask the maid service to change our pillow cases. The original ones smelled. But everything was corrected. Avoid the hotel restaurant. The food is SUPER overpriced and mediocre at best. No worries - simply walk the short distance down the street and they're tons of restaurants and cafes on the walk to the Eiffel Tower. There is also a small corner grocery store where you can buy very inexpensive snacks and sandwiches. Also - they charge a ridiculous amount for internet access in the lobby. You would think this would be FREE by now.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to Write Home About!”
Reviews.Author: Claymires
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Renaissance Trocadero and the best thing about the hotel is the location. Its very central for all siteseeing and we were able to walk to all attractions - the Eiffel Tower is a 10 minute walk from the hotel. The room was expensive (as all rooms are in the centre of Paris). We requested a room for 3 adults and got a double bed and a childs style bed! Reception are helpful but note when they order a taxi for you, they charhe 4.50 Euros for the service! We were charged 30 Euros for a bottle of wine in the hotel which we found in the supermarket for 9 Euros so beware!! There was nothing terrible about the hotel, but if I returned to Paris I would probably look around for another hotel, for perhaps better value. Highly recommended is the Moulin Rouge dinner show & also the Parisiens evening dinner boat cruise - both 100% worth the money!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room, service, breakfast....”
Reviews.Author: MtngrlEmmy
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend August 10th-17th. We stayed using her Marriott Reward points. The room was nice and spacious, maid service was good. Breakfast suited our needs, although I can't imagine anyone would pay 27E for it, it was free because of my friends status. I would pay max 10USD for what they offered. We really were not in the room that often. Slept and showered there. We did sit in the courtyard with a bottle of wine one evening (purchased down the street for 5E) and really enjoyed that. We met two people one evening who told us they were also in Paris and staying at a Marriot (with status) and I believe they told us we should have stayed at Renaissance Paris Vendome Hotel. It is more points. Overall it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: javabean7052
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed two nights at this hotel during a three day visit to Paris. This was my first trip to Paris and I had booked this hotel using reward points. This hotel is located in a quiet residential area a 10 minute walk to either the Eiffel Tower or the Arc de Triomphe. It is between the Victor Hugo metro station and the Trocadero metro station which are on two different lines. We had flown into Orly from Barcelona early in the morning. We then took the Orlybus into town, caught the metro to Trocadero and walked the remaining blocks to the hotel. We were traveling with a single totebag each so luggage was not an issue. We went directly to the hotel to ask if we could leave our totebags for the day. When we arrived at the hotel the young man at the front desk asked us to wait a few minutes and he would check with housekeeping to see if our room was ready. And it was! At 10AM we were settled into our room. As a rewards member we had been upgraded to a junior suite facing the garden courtyard area, which was lovely. There are a number of buildings which make up this hotel. You have to walk through the garden area to reach the rear buildings. I wonder how this works in a rainstorm? Our 3rd floor suite 355 consisted of the huge Marriott bed, full closet with dresser drawers inside, safe, window seat, flatscreen tv, desk, couch, lounge chairs, minibar, AC, bath & shower with 1/2 glass enclosure, scale, and bathrobe. It was very spacious and well maintained. Ice is brought up to your room by room service. Our room faced the garden but there was no view because we were an end room which looked toward the next building. It was very quiet at night. There is a workout area, full service restaurant, and breakfast was served in a smaller dining area although I would imagine the garden courtyard is used. Mornings were cool when we were there. Breakfast was a nice buffet, but at 27 euros is a lot for breakfast. Upon checkout the hotel held our totebags for the day and we reversed the transportation process to return to Orly. Two negatives. The entire hotel lost hot water in the morning, so no shower. Also, both of our key cards became deactivated and we had to walk across the courtyard and back to the front desk late at night. I overheard someone else having this problem the next morning. As mentioned before, the view of the Eiffel Tower from the Trocadero Gardens is outstanding, during the day and especially at night. You can not find a better place to see the Tower. The bridge leading from Trocadero Gardens over the Seine is also where the tour boats are located. This was a wonderful hotel and a good location. The staff at the front of the house were wonderful. They employ security which is openly visible. The rates for this hotel are high. I imagine there are "better" locations but with a city the size of Paris this hotel and the Trocadero Gardens get my vote for being places to relax and reenergize before taking off for more sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasent Stay”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler43
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from July 17, 2009 - July 24, 2009. We had two rooms (one for mom and dad, and one for teenage son and daughter). Our rooms were not connecting but were on the same floor rooms 154 and 159. The rooms were nearly identical, except that the adults had a king size bed and a slightly larger bathroom then the kids twin bedded room. The rooms were on the small side--perfectly adequate for two-and nicely appointed with attractive furnishings, a flat screen tv with a dozen or so channels a few of which broadcast in English. As others have mentioned in their reviews, the AC was not the most effective cooling unit I have ever seen, but the weather on our trip was pretty mild, so we did not have an issue. If there were an extended heat wave, I could see where the rooms would not be as comfortable. The rooms were quiet--I did not hear any noise from the adjoing room, and the beds were comfortable, so it was easy to get a good night's sleep. Becasue of my Marriott Award's Status, we were given free breakfast each morning. The hotel offered a very nice buffet with eggs, cheeses, breads, juice, crepes, etc. the buffet was priced at 27 Euros per person, so if I had to pay for it, I would have passed--nice, but way over priced. the hotel has a very nice courtyard where you can have dinner or drinks when the the weather cooperates--we never dined there, but they did a good business, and it looked like it would have been a nice spot to spend an evening. The hotel service was very good---we checked in about 3PM, and were taken directly to our rooms by the woman behnd the frontdesk who checked us in. We used the concierge twice for restaurant recommendations--one recommednation was quite good, the other good, but not great. The hotel's location was, for us, perfect. The hotel is on a pretty quiet street that is not terribly touristy. You are located about midway between two subway stations (Victor Hugo and Trocadero), each about a 5 minute walk away, so getting around town was a breeze. You are also only about a 15 minute walk from the Arc de Triumph, and between the hotel and the Arc, there is a ton of high-end shoppig for those who have money to burn. We walked back from the Eiffel Tower one evening after 1AM, (maybe 1 25 mintue walk) and felt perfectly safe. We stayed at the hotel using Marriott Reward points, so all we had to pay was the city hotel tax. Based on what I saw posted at the hotel, the room rates go for 450-650 Euros per night. It was a nice hotel, good location, comfortable, etc. but if I had to pay for the rooms myself, I am not sure I would have stayed--I would not describe the place as great value at those prices. Finally, I would also mention, that if you are lookng fro a hotel where you can immerse yourself in French culture, this is not the place for you. I honestly think evry guest I saw in the hallway, dining room, or lobby was an American. Nothing wrong with that, but if yo never left the hotel, you would think you were in Kansas City.

Reviews.Title: “Rough experience - no A/C or ventilation, flooded bathroom, room not avail on arrival”
Reviews.Author: PaulSEA1
Reviews.Content: This was my third worst stay at a Marriott property. I'm a Marriott platinum member with 75+ nights per year at Marriotts and have been travelling extensively for a decade. 1. Our room was not available on check-in. They told us it would be 20 minutes but it actually took about an hour. We finally got our room at 5:30pm. It was a hot July day, we had arrived on the hot metro, and were very keen on having a shower ASAP. Every time I passed the front desk during my two day stay there was some kind of drama going on about the guest's room not being available. This seemed to be the normal state of affairs here. 2. The room we finally got had no working ventiallation whatsoever. There was a thermostat and a vent, but with the fan set on maximum the air moving out the vent was not enough to budge a tissue. Other tripadvisors have commented on the same problem so it appears to be a known deficiency at the property. As I said before, it was a very hot day so the lack of AC made the room very uncomfortable. Given the ordeal getting our room in the first place I didn't bother asking for a move on the first night. 3. The bathroom had only a small bath tub and no shower curtain. Taking a shower resulted in a flooded bathroom. There was water damage and peeling plaster to show for its repeated abuse. I cleaned up the flood with my towel but the hotel did not replace wet towels at turn-down time. We had to request replacements. 4. The room was otherwise very nice and more interstingly decorated than most Marriott properties. The platinum petit fours arrival gift was generous and came with two beers. 5. My pregnant wife became ill in the wee hours of the first morning. The hotel was very helpful in getting us a doctor who arrived in less than 30 minutes. It turned out her problem was the heat. The hotel immediately upgraded us to a suite in the main building. The main building AC was fantastic and the suite was great. Why did they make me wait so long to check in when they had a vacant suite???? I was happy to have the suite, but it had come at a high price of lost sleep, sick wife, and 120 Euros for the doctor. 6. The suite had the same flooding shower problem and no towel replacement. If you stay here do not accept a room in the adjunct building, only take the main building. Your best bet is to stay away. Internet 20 Euros per day or 7 Euros per hour.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel in a fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: mimis6
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Parc Trocadero was wonderful-a spacious 1 bedroom suite overlooking the beautiful courtyard-a staff that could not have been more helpful, efficent, kind, friendly and a location that was beautiful, quiet, residential (16th) but still within walking distance of all the major sights. Paris has wonderful public transportation-clean, efficent, safe. My favorite-the Batobus. Get a two-day pass and cruise down the Seine with 8 different stops. We found three amazing restaurants within walking distance of the hotel-Le Petit Retro, La Table Lauriston and (our personal Favorite) Le Stella Brasserie.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay...great location”
Reviews.Author: lambertbunch
Reviews.Content: Pros: Walking distance to Eiffel Tower! Convenient to restaurants and metro station Jr. Suite accomodates 2 adults & 2 children. Large hotel room compared to others we have stayed at in Europe. Disney Escape Package a good value for families. Includes: Disney Tix, Suite, and Breakfast Very helpful staff Cons Can't think of any.....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holls33
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel, updated trendy rooms...clean. We did have to laugh about our housekeeper though. One day we didn't have towels, the next no chocolate with turn down service, another day she turned the heater up so hi we died coming in the room. It was more of a comical thing than a big issue we wondered if she forgot her meds!!! ha They make you pay for internet which is crappy...so if you have an iphone, you won't be able to use e-mail even if you have a prepaid data package. The rooms are small so be prepared....If you have been to NYC you know what I mean. They are not horribly bad though. The location is fantastic...5-10 min walk to ET, ARC...CE etc. Close metro stations. The concierge was very helpful each time we needed something...train tickets, reservations etc.... We did eat at the new restaurant run by Alain Duchase (butchered his name) it was fantastic. The courtyard area is beautiful and quiet...great place to end the day with a glass of wine. I would recommend this hotel for someone who has never been to Paris and wants something familiar (i.e. Marriott family of hotels), also because of it's location. I personally will try another hotel next time just because it's Paris and there are so many areas to explore, but I do recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel provided friendly, helpful service and was centrally located for the areas I most wanted to visit.”
Reviews.Author: jadbrowal
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was small and I anticipated a great service attitude. I was very pleased with the helpfulness of all the staff. The room was small by American standards but quite sufficient and the bed was fabulous after a long day of much walking. This hotel is an excellent choice for those who expect courtesy (by also extending it to the French). This is also a great hotel for those who want to take in the most traditional sites of Paris and be able to walk to them. A great overall stay and I would return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel & Great Location. Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Rob CC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel on our first trip to Paris. It was in a GREAT location - walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triumph, etc. It was also easy to get to multiple Metro (subway) stops. Hotel staff was VERY helpful ... nice, helpful, spoke English when needed (for someone who didn't speak a lot of French), etc. Clean rooms, clean courtyard and solid restaurant selection within walking distance. Plus, a close grocery store if you wanted to shop a bit on your own. Overall, we would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to any family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MV_Troll
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, great room. The staff was superb and the buffet breakfast was definetely ok! Location is great, between the Arc and the Effeil tower. The only shame is the lacking of a swimming pool. However, I had really good time: the restaurant was superb, the room big and the bathroom big and clean. The bed was the largest I have seen in my life!!!

Reviews.Title: “Proved the "French Hate Americans Theory" to be true”
Reviews.Author: TempleUgirl
Reviews.Content: My mother and I visited this hotel on our way back from Kenya. We couldn't have been more excited to arrive in Paris and once we did, we couldn't wait for the plane that would take us home. The airport itself was a nightmare and unless you speak the language, the people are very rude. The cab driver that picked us up threw our bags into the car and completely over-charged us for the fare. Upon arriving at the Hotel the staff was cold and unwelcoming. The room itself was nice and had the most comfortable bed and view of the Eiffel Tower though. The bathroom was always clean, but the tv only has one station in English, CNN. The food at the hotel is ver expensive as is the food throughout most of the city. I brick-oven pizza, a coke, and a glass of red wine cost us over $80USD! The hotel then attempted to charge us almost $700USD upon check-out for using our calling card to call home for connection fees, that they assured us was only $5USD for connection fee when we checked in. We had to argue with the manager for the entire last night that we stayed and the following morning and we still ended up having to pay $350USD! It's a shame because the city is so beautiful, but the people are just cold. I wouldn't visit Paris again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and quaint hotel. Well situated and excellent for the first time traveler to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Nice_Life_69
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a weekday late evening, approx 8:30 pm. It was nice as we were the only ones at the front desk and had their full attention. At the exterior, the hotel looks quaint and nice. Lobby is just a little small but pretty classy (white marble, good layout). The room given to us was very clean to begin with. The carpet felt brand-new and even my wife, who is a very particular person about cleanliness, commented that it's one of the cleanest hotel carpets she had seen. Having said that, the general cleanliness of the room was pretty good. No issues at all! The location of the hotel is excellent. It's within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and the Champs Elysees shopping district. The hotel is very near other shopping streets (eg. Victor Hugo) and is fairly near the area where embassies are located. I would urge first time travelers to Paris to factor in the importance of a hotel's location as this makes it so much easier for you to move around. The hotel has a little french restaurant within its premises "Le Relais du Parc" that is part of the chain set up by the internationally acclaimed Alain Ducasse. It has a beautiful charming courtyard. Breakfast is served in this restaurant. One important tip is to check if the hotel rate includes daily breakfast. The hotel also has a little drinking lounge. Looks nice but I did not try it as I am a lousy drinker. The hotel's gym is very well maintained, clean and pleasant. Seems that the gym is hardly used as the equipment are all very new. The hotel has a ready supply of UK and US newspapers which is a plus for me. Internet access in the room is pretty pricey at 6.99 euros per hour. The only thing I found inconvenient was that the bathtub was fitted with a quarter-length glass pane which was inadequate for keeping water from splashing out onto the floor if you are showering while standing in the bathtub. I encountered this type of hotel design when I stayed in Italy a couple of years back. I believe this is a common toilet design in Europe. The concierge is pretty helpful with their recommendation of places to visit and restaurants in the vicinity. There is also a security person stationed at the entrance of the hotel around the clock (with an armband marked "Securite"). Overall, I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a good, clean start with their stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: wc1208
Reviews.Content: We checked in to the hotel and right away could tell that we were in for a treat. The location is very convenient to several metro stops and of course, walking distance to the Champs de Mar and the Eiffel Tower. There are a few buildings to choose from, so make sure you notice them and ask if rooms are available facing the courtyard. There is coffee/tea service in the lobby and they have a lovely restaurant onsite. We are going back this year, May 2009 and cannot wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: BigDaddy3859
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our first (only so far) trip to Paris. We chose this hotel because we liked the location, a quiet neighborhood but still near some attractions and easy metro access. We used Marriott rewards and being platinum they upgraded us, we even had a partial view of the Eiffel Tower. Easy walk to the Eiffel Tower and Arc de Triomphe, about 10 minutes max. Great access to 2 different metro stops to have easy access to anywhere in the city. The breakfast each morning was very good, nothing fancy, but a large variety and good quality. We never had dinner at the hotel but found lots of great places nearby, always an easy evening stroll. The tree lined street that the hotel is on is very nice. We always felt very safe, even at night. Our room was very large, clean and well furnished, and the complemetary champagne with chocolates, then wine and fruit. was very nice. Staff was very helpful with advise and directions. I would recommend this hotel for anyone looking to get out of the hustle and bustle of the downtown hotels, but also be advised that this hotel is not in a central location if that is important. We loved Paris, and are looking forward to a return trip someday. We would be very happy to stay here again, but would probably try something different for a change.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: familyoffiveTampa_FL
Reviews.Content: My husband was in Paris on business and I decided to join him. We used Marriott points. We stayed here 2 nights. I think it was, literally, the first day they reopened after a renovation. The paint was still wet in the lobby. I believe they upgraded us because we had a loft style, 2 story room. The stairs are extremely steep - I would not recommend for elderly or children. In fact, my 40 year old husband fell down the stairs in the middle of the night! I thought the hotel was very nice. We were there in Jan. but I bet the courtyard in the back of the hotel is exquisite in the spring and summer. Very close to the Eiffel Tower. Exceptional bedding, 2 flat screen TVs, new bathroom. We had the buffet breakfast (complimentary for Platinum members) and it was very good. If I am ever so luck to go to Paris again I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad Marriott option in the 16eme”
Reviews.Author: consultantguydfw
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay here since it was a Marriott property and I needed a few extra nights to requalify for Marriott Rewards Platinium. A co-worker booked here, and our corporate travel rate beat the rate on the Marriott website by 49 EUR a night. I stayed at this property from a Wed to Sat (paid, business), and then I stayed at the Marriott Rive Gauche on points for an additional three nights. I arrived early on the flight from Dallas, but I only had to wait 5-10 minutes for them to finish preparing my room. They said they put me in a superior room, which overlooked the courtyard. The room came with a queen sized bed with a flat screen tv, sitting chair, desk, and a small bathroom with a shower (no tub) that drained slowly and leaked lots of water on the floor. Although the bathroom was a bit small (as typical in Paris), it was decent and functional. The queen size bed was quite comfy. As a Marriott Platinum, the breakfast buffet was included (otherwise would have cost 27 EUR) since they do not have an executive lounge. The corporate travel website said that internet was included, but it was not. Transportation access isn't bad. The hotel is between the Victor Hugo and Tracadero metro stops. There are a couple of grocery stores nearby (a Fran Prix and a 8 à HUIT). I would stay here again, but it would not be my first choice. I prefer the Marriott Rive Gauche, which I stayed at on this trip using Marriott points. It is usually cheaper, they upgraded me to a suite, and they have an executive lounge with free internet access in the lounge and two computer terminals if you don't have your own laptop. The location of the Marriott Rive Gauche slightly beats the Renaissance - the 16eme arrondissment doesn't do much for me. The Marriott Rive Gauche has great airport public transporation options with the Orly Bus stopping right in front of the hotel and Denfert-Rochereau a moderate walk away to take the RER B to CDG.

Reviews.Title: “Good neighborhood, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: amcolo
Reviews.Content: Upon check in we found the hotel staff to be very cold and somewhat unfriendly. The room was TINY - although the furnishings were nice, the room was clean and the bathroom was very nice. We also found the room to be quite noisy. Our room overlooked the interior courtyard - activity starts in this courtyard very early in the morning with staff rolling carts, and people eating breakfast. Throughout our 4 night stay here, the staff was continually very cold and it seemed many staff did not know what they were doing. On the plus side, we really enjoyed the location of the hotel which is somewhat off the typical tourist path in Paris. The hotel is just minutes from the Eiffel Tower and about 10 minutes from the Arc de Triomphe. Two metro stops are also very close by. We enjoyed exploring the Trocadero neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, but a few issues”
Reviews.Author: UpgradeQueen
Reviews.Content: Lots of pros and cons about this hotel, but my bottom line is that we had a terrific stay. This was our 3rd time using Marriott points in Paris, we have previously been to Place Vendome, which we love but never get a great room there. Okay, PROS first: Excellent location, quiet side street, near Metro, Eiffel Tower, cafes, walk to Musee Marmottan, Passy & Bois de Boulogne. Largest room I've ever had in Paris. Junior Suite room 172 has nice windows overlooking the courtyard, quiet, with trees in front for privacy, good light. A hallway/entryway, separate WC from bathroom, sitting area, decent closet space, fabulously comfortable bed, fridge/mini-bar, about 5 English TV channels, more than most Euro hotels. Nice bathroom, 2 sinks, good counter space. Good internet connection (but you have to pay). Completely free using standard Marriott points, including large breakfast for two every day, delivered to our room. LOVED that. Pretty good service. They really try to please, but I will never understand why top Elite status Marriott members hve to beg for decent rooms. Our building had a courtyard entrance, not having to go through the lobby after dinner, which I loved. Still very convenient to lobby for stopping at concierge, etc. CONS: I had called in advance, arrived at 4 pm, didn't get room of choice but did have 2 options. Other rooms not ready. We are Platinum Elite members so you would think we'd get the best they have, but those rooms never seem to be ready. Rooms do not look as spiffy as on the website. When Renaissance took them over in April of this year (2008), they replaced carpet and drapes but haven't "renovated" the rooms, as it says. Bathoom was marble but had NO electrical outlet. Hallways are tired, need painting, not a glamorous, 5-star atmosphere, but typically French and definitely not depressing or seedy. Small lobby, just a few chairs, not fancy at all, but I don't have a problem with that. If you don't want your room sprayed with perfume, make sure to tell them (ech!!!). They do it when they clean and turn down. $20/day charge for wireless. It took a day to get A/C working properly and all the lights on. Dining room is not open Sunday/Monday nights. Overall, it was a pleasant, light, comfortable room with plenty of space for our three weeks worth of luggage, clothes, toiletries and chargers. We ended up being very happy there after the initial battle for the best room we could get.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Area”
Reviews.Author: gwillen100
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from 10 days in France. For 2 nights we stayed at the Hotel Le Parc. It is in a beautiful and quiet area off Victor Hugo. Easy access to the Metropolitan station. It has a great courtyard for having an evening glass of wine or dinner. Unfortunately, when we were there the weather was a little cooler so we were not able to enjoy it as much. The staff was very helpful. The week before we had stayed at the Le Grand, Intercontinental Hotel. It was also very nice, but was about $200 more per night than the Le Parc. The Intercontinental was located by the Opera House and was an excellent hotel. However, all in all I would probably return to the Le Parc on my next trip to Paris due to the lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: akdaley2003
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 7 nights at the Hotel Le Parc in Paris, and I believe the easiest way to write this review to separate the hotel into GOOD and BAD. So... The GOOD... 1. As stated in other reviews, the hotel is in a good location, close to the Eiffel Tower, Champ d'Elysees, and Arc d' Triomphe. The hotel is also close to several metro and bus stops (including Tour Buses) 2. The rooms are small compared to other Marriott-owned hotels in the US and Asia, but adequate for any major city. The bed is comfortable, the rooms are clean, and housekeeping does a good job of making sure rooms are turned down and cleaned properly on a daily basis. 3.The hotel restaurant is pricey (see BAD section below), especially considering the hotel restaurants ranking as an okay "19" for food by Zagat. On the bright side, there are plenty of better priced/better quality restaurants within walking distance, or just a metro ride away. 4. There is also a local grocer about two blocks past the hotel which sells water (1 Euro for a 16 oz bottle), cheap wine, champagne, sandwiches, and snacks. Toward Victor Hugo Circle, there is a pharmacy as well as a bakery (which has the BEST chocolate croissants - 1,25 Euros). 5. The entire staff was English speaking, and for the most part was very friendly, and willing to help with any request. The BAD... 1. The hotel is over-priced. Not the room rate (you need to expect certain costs for certain types of hotels, especially in major cities), but instead the restaurant, bar, internet, movies, mini-bar, etc., etc., etc. For instance, 1 hour of internet access is $7 Euros, which may not sound like a lot, but considering other Marriott owned hotels offer FREE internet, the extra cost seems unreasonable and overpriced. In addition, a drink at the bar comes at a price premium of nearly 400% as compared to the cafes, bistros, and restaurants only a block away. 2. PHONE CARDS - My wife and I bought a local phone card to call the United States. The card was 7,50 Euro. We asked the concierge where to purchase the card, followed his instructions, and came to find out (from the same concierge), that the hotels computer does not allow Phone cards to be used (See over-priced section in The Bad #1). The hotel even tried to charge my wife and me for trying to use the card (but they were nice enough to not charge us the fees). 3. Limited Tour Arrangements. The hotel only teams with one tour Company (or at least that is what were told), so plan your days prior to arriving in Paris, or be prepared to pay double. OVERALL - ABOVE AVERAGE Paris is an easy city to find cheaper alternatives to the expensive hotel offered services, which help you overcome the hotels flaws. With that, the hotel’s location, friendly staff, and nice rooms, make it above average, and worth your consideration for your stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EWScranton
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Paris and this was the perfect place to stay! What a fabulous location. We were three blocks from the eiffel tower and a short walk to the Champs D'Elysse. It was amazing. We actually were able to walk mostly everywhere except when we took the train out to Versailles. (Which I would HIGHLY recommend- it was absolutely incredible). The hotel itself is great. It's located in a nice safe part of Paris. Our room was wonderful. Big huge king size bed with white comforter and comfortable bed linens. Our bathroom was huge and it was all marbled. We had a room that was bigger than the average room. (Not sure how we got that- but it was great!) The windows opened up out to the courtyard- which was so pretty. The breakfast each morning that was included in our plan was a great hearty breakfast to get you through till lunch. Although, if you wanted to, you could walk down the street and grab a croissant for 1 euro. Oh and a bit of advice- if you want to take the night river boat trip down the Seine (no dinner included- which I would recommend because we got off and went and had our own dinner-much less expensive and just as fun) Get your tickets at the dock. Especially if you stay here, the walk to the water was a couple blocks and we got ripped off paying $90 each to take a bus from across the water (that we had to cross to meet the bus) back closer to our hotel. Most people just bought the tickets for the night cruise at the gate and that was definitely the way to go. And if you are thinking that you can't travel to Europe because of the weak dollar, don't listen to yourself. We set a budget for every day and were able to stay within it because of the fixed meal options. All restaurants have their menus posted outside so you can check it out before you go in. All in all, It was a perfect hotel for what we needed. We walked a lot and so we definitely loved that our room was nice and comfy to come back to after a long day of exploring. I would most definitely recommend this hotel- especially to anyone who is making their first trip to Paris and wants a great hotel with a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Botique Hotel in Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: jackosan
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Le Parc Trocadero served very well as the base of operations for my daughter and me during a week's stay in Paris in early August. Located in the heart of the 16th Arrondissement, an upscale residential area, the hotel is a 10-15-minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe or the Eiffel Tower. Victor Hugo is the nearest metro stop. Trocadero and Boissiere are also close at hand. There are numerous mid-priced restaurants in the area and several markets to pick up wine, snacks and sandwich makings for the room or for picnicking. The hotel is comprised of several interconnected townhouse-type buildings surrounding a central courtyard. The "Superior" room was small, but well-appointed. The windows opened wide and faced onto the courtyard. Traffic noise was minimal. The twin beds were pushed together, but we were able to separate them by moving around the nightstands. Most importantly, it had the extraordinarily comfortable beds that one expects of the Renaissance brand. The bathroom was tight, but clean with very nice toiletries. The lack of a door/curtain on the bathtub/shower does take some getting used to, however. Sadly, Renaissance continues to charge (read gouge) for internet access, a service that is free in most enlightened hotels in the 21st Century. Service was friendly and professional, if sometimes lackadaisical. One glitch -- when we arrived to check in at 5:00 p.m., our room still was not ready. They were very apologetic, though, and invited us to enjoy drinks on the house in the courtyard while they readied the room, and then sent up a bottle of wine and a tin of butter cookies along with a note of apology. On the other hand, on the evening of our sixth night, a knock at the door brought delivery of a complimentary fruit platter and another bottle of wine -- a very nice touch. I cannot comment on how the room price compares to similar hotels in Paris, because we used Marriott Reward points. Given that the lowest published price I saw for that period was €299, I thought we got very good value for our standard award. We did not eat at the hotel. The restaurant was closed for vacation during August, though I understand that breakfast was available. In fact, much of the 16th was closed for the annual August vacances. We had much better luck finding shops and businesses open in other less affluent, and more touristed, parts of the city. The Latin Quarter, in particular, was a good bet for finding a large variety of decent, moderately-priced restaurants during August. Convivium, a Sicilian restaurant at Place Victor Hugo was one excellent restaurant that we found open near the hotel (though it was at the outer edge of our price range given the weakness of the US dollar). With 5 bags, a Saturday morning taxi run to Charles De Gaulle ran €50, a similar ride in from Orly the prior Saturday afternoon cost €34, so if you're traveling light, you can save a bundle by taking public transportation. Also, if you like to walk (and Paris really is a walking city), you'll do better periodically buying carnets (10-packs) of metro/bus tickets (€11.40) than buying transit passes.

Reviews.Title: “High end hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Prassina
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my husband and our two daughters for 2 nights. The hotel is conveniently located close to the Eiffel Tower (a 20 minute walk with our 7 and 4 year old), bus stops and the metro station. There are several restaurants and cafes nearby as well as a small open air market on the Rue Saint Didier (1-2 minutes walk) where you can buy fresh fruit and cheese. Our room - a suite with a loft - was fairly large by French standards. It had a very comfortable master bed, a modern bathroom, a pull out bed for the kids, and overlooked the attractive hotel garden and outdoor restaurant. We were very pleased with the service. The generous breakfast buffet was excellent. One word of caution: we asked the concierge to help us with changing train reservations. He was prompt and efficient but there is a hefty fee for his services!

Reviews.Title: “not what you'd expect”
Reviews.Author: EUtravelgal
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on location and room...in Paris it's virtually impossible to stay with a family of 4 without booking two rooms. This hotel put us in an executive suite (217) for 379 Euros per night...better than the cost of 2 rooms elsewhere. The lower area was a pull out sofa bed that was extremely comfortable, and the upper room (loft) had a king bed and full bath. But that's where the fun ended. The renovation which took place at the beginning of the year already seems tired. Wallpaper is peeling off the walls, painted surfaces beat up and scratched, and the room had a funny musty smell. The tub and bathroom had seen better days, and the chain lock had been broken off the door. The TV in the upstairs did not work (not that we really wanted to watch it anyways, but again...very, very average. The staff as always was fabulous (this was my second stay), truly, but I really expected more from a Renaissance. The metro station is not that close (about a 10 minute walk to Trocodero) but the main attractions are within reach. All in all I'd say that the location was quite average. I do not believe I will come back, there are too many other choices in the city which are better. And I would never ever spend my Marriott points here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelgyrl71
Reviews.Content: I booked a last minute trip to Paris for the July 4th weekend. I usually stay in the Latin Quarter, but this time wanted a change. I found this Renaissance on the Marriott website and was charmed by the photos of the courtyard. Without a doubt it was the perfect choice. Prior to arrival I sent a request to the concierge requesting information on wine tastings and jazz clubs. Not only did they reply to my e-mail, but also followed up with a phone call. Upon arrival at the hotel (approx 1 pm), the check in was immediately processed. During check in the concierge heard my name and without hesitation asked if I had any questions or any additional request. What service! The staff escorted me to my room (715) which overlooks the courtyard. The hotel is in a residential area with small cafes with friendly staff. As a woman traveling alone, I never felt uncomortable or unsafe in this area. The staff at the cafes were kind and welcoming - even though bonjour and champagne is the extent of my French. It was a leisurely 6 minute walk to the Trocadero metro station and an additional 4 minutes to the Eiffel Tour. Even though I was only in Paris for two nights, the staff at the Renaissance went out of there way to ensure that I was satisfied. I returned from Paris relaxed and refreshed. I would not hesitate to recommend or stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “What was that!!!”
Reviews.Author: sxa93
Reviews.Content: I must say, this hotel left me wishing I had picked someplace else! First of all, I had booked a suite, but was told on arrival the suite was taken, and we could have a superior room. Great! I've been upgraded for non availability, but down graded? That was a first. I let that pass, only because the lady at the reception was so apologetic about it that my wife and I felt sorry at her embarassment. The room looked nothing for the amount of money that was charged. But then, thats Paris! Nothing comes cheap. The breakfast had a decent spread though. The location is ok. Stone's throw away from Victor Hugo, and not too far from Champs Elysees. On the whole, the experience felt like a good 3 star hotel. Perhaps I had too many expectations.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: nmprincess06
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in Feb , It was our first stay in paris, and i thought this hotel was fantastic!!! When we checked in we had no wait and everyone was really helpful. We were in our room within 10mins. We had a room across the courtyard, which was really nice, The room was fantastic, huge bed, best nights sleep i've ever had!!! We didn't use the courtyard at all as it was too cold to sit outside, but i'd imagin this is really nice in the summer, Breakfast was great, lots of choice. bacon, eggs, sausges, everything for a fry up, plus muffins, pastries, yoghurts, fresh fruit, hams cheese, have a good breakfast and it will keep you going most the day. As our room was across the courtyard, you didnt have to walk through reception everytime you came and went to the hotel, as they have an entrance next to the main entrace which goes straight into the courtyard. The only time this was closed was at night where you had to use reception. The hotel was only a 5 min walk from the nearest metro. 5/10 min walk to the Eiffell tower, and about 15 the Ard De Triomph. Overall we had a fantastic time, and if i go back to Paris I will be staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: dinobja
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent Marriott guest and have stayed at many all over teh world. This Marriott was very clean, however I found the employees very cold towards us. There is no real lobby and I felt like they were giving us the stink eye everytime we came and went. I also found myself waiting in line for everything. For instance you check in at the "front desk" you have to get your keys from the conceirge who is 3 feet away and there was a line. So I had to wait in two lines just to check in. In addition the airconditioning does not work. It is in a decent location as far as getting to metro stops. The room is small but that is to be expected in Europe. The bathroom was modern and in good condition.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: CaroleNorthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: an absolutly wonderful hotel. I took my mother for 4 nights and it couldn't have been better.We had a lovely room overlooking the courtyard, it was so peacfull it was difficult to imagine that you were in the middle of paris. We had our breakfast included in the price but even though it seems expensive i would say it was worth every penny. When considering you pay between 7 and 10 euros for 2 coffee's 27 euros gets you a lot of food, There is everything could think of from fresh friut, to every type of bread imaginable to a good cooked breakfast and theres no restriction on how much you have. The staff at the hotel are so lovely, we had a lot of problems with the excursions i had booked via my travel agent and without the concierges help i would have been passed myself. If your looking for a good quiet hotel, central to everything, with first class service I'd say look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel, good location, expensive”
Reviews.Author: Stevie390
Reviews.Content: As others have said, this hotel is in an attractive and convenient location close to the Eiffel Tower. It is near to Victor Hugo Metro Station and a handy 20-minutes from the Eurostar terminal at Gare du Nord. The hotel staff were very friendly and very efficient. The rooms are located in a couple of detached blocks situated around a pretty central courtyard. I had a superior room which was an excellent size and very acceptable. It included large bathroom, large tv, minibar, armchair, sufficient cupboard space, iron with board and a very comfortable bed. No tea/coffee facilities. The breakfast was extensive, but costly at 27 euros (or 18 euros for continental). I didn't use the hotel restaurant, but it looked good. The hotel could do with another more cost-effective dining/cafe/snack option, although, being Paris, there are numerous other options in the area. Overall, this hotel was an excellent but costly base for a weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: RoyRooster
Reviews.Content: Found reviews from trip advisor helpful then put in Le Parc Paris in search address and booked online. Room was very clean even behind bed, etc. People there very helpful and pleasant. 8 minute walk to Le Defense Arch and less than 5 minutes the other way is the Effile Tower - Great location. About $1200 for 3 nights... Ate breakfast buffet once was very good but a little high. Went to local shops for coffee and pastry - cheaper and pastries in that area are great. Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Le Parc is the hotel for Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Englishman_Travel
Reviews.Content: Traveling from England on the Eurostar, the moment my partner and I arrived at Hotel Le Parc (now a Marriot) after a short walk from Victor Hugo metro, we received an extremely warm welcome and felt immediately at home. Our room looked out over the romantic courtyard and was spacious for our needs. With one of the most comfortable beds (2 singles pushed together) and bigger than your average double bed, we didn't want to leave! The room also had a 32" HD TV with Internet access, WIFI and an easy to use safe. At night the Air Conditioning drys your mouth out a bit too much so the complimentary water was very welcome. Our bathroom was clean, tidy with nice marble top surrounding the sink and plenty of storage underneath, only the shower type let the bathroom down, not being very powerful and water going everywhere. We went down for breakfast to be greeted by a feast of everything you could want to eat: Cereals, Fruit Salad, Yoghurt, Hams, Cheeses, Fish, pastries, Waffles, Pancakes, Full English and selections of Tea and Juices... and a few other things I've probably missed out!!!! This more than helped with my partner being Gluten intolerant. The hotel is in the perfect location and we were in walking distance of both the Eiffel Tower and the Arc De Triomphe, everything else is reachable using the 2 metro stations either end of Ramond Poincaré (the closest Victor Hugo & Trocadero). If you're looking for great places to eat: Just off the Eiffel Tower is La Billebaude, 29 Rue De l'Exposition served fantastic fresh traditional food with very friendly service and also La Villa Corse, 164, boulevard de Grenelle which had such a comfortable feel and great atmosphere. If you're shopping at Au Printemps, 64, Blvd Haussman, you must go to the trendy stained glass dome restaurant (6th floor). And finally the Musée du Louvre then Café Marly is a very posh café for a relaxing lunch. Our last night was very romantic, eating at Le Récamier, 4 Rue Récamier which serves great food attracting writers, journalists & Politicians. Our check-out was as warm as our welcome with all staff helping us. This hotel is perfectly placed in a nice quiet area of Paris but within walking distance and Metro rides of all the best bits. If you're looking at staying in Paris, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Le Parc Valintines Day”
Reviews.Content: After years of getting my wife squat for Valentines Day I decided to surprise her with a trip to Paris this year. Although now once again it is back to squat. I Booked a 4 night stay at the LPT thru AA vacations.com. It cost $2100 usd with air/ breakfast and hotel transfers from SoCal. The 2nd leg of the flight was great! Straight from DFW to CDG, All in one long nights sleep. 10 hours. (Thanks to the drugs of course.) We arrived at the LPT in the late morning and checked right in since our room was ready. The hotel has 4 floors with 0 floor being the ground floor? Our room was on the 1st floor. Thats 1 floor up from 0 floor? There are 2 separate areas of this hotel. The main area being accessed directly from the lobby. And ours, the other area being accessed from the courtyard. Both are connected but separate? The first floor is their nonsmoking floor. However I don't think there are many requests from the French for a non smoking room . Our room was spotlessly clean and stayed so all week. Turn down service was a nice touch with Godiva chocolates and another cleaning of the room. As stated in an earlier review the LPT is now a Marriott property. So a good use of your Marriott points would be to upgrade to a Tower view room. They have 2or3? The service here was perfect. What ever we asked for was quickly addressed. We were given a room with a queen instead of a king as we requested and when we asked about it we were told most hotels put quests in queens because the kings are just two twins put together and people complain about that. The queen turned out great because the mattress and bedding were delightful. The breakfast here is great. Lacking nothing. Technically called a buffet but they will cook you anything you ask for right on the spot. Do not eat lunch! You won't/don't need it. Your pants will thank you. The hotel is located a short walk between the tower and the arc. And close to the double decker bus stop. $22euro for a 2 day pass and It stops at all the hot spots. There are plenty of restaurants nearby. Our favorites were Le Petite Retro and a Guy Savoy moderate$ called Le Butte Chaillot. Expect to pay from around $80 to $130 euros for a nice dinner for two with wine there. One word of caution while walking around. Watch out for the land mines! The hotel is located in a semi residential area and It seems as if every family has a dog. Ruff said.

Reviews.Title: “OuI! C'est tres Bien!”
Reviews.Author: VacationsAreSoFun
Reviews.Content: This was for our 2nd half of the Honeymoon. Booked through Cos*co dot com and got a rate in the low one hundreds for 5 days. Pros- Location: - 5 minutes walk from Eiffel Tower or Arc de Triumphe, and Trocadero metro stop. - Restaurants, a Bakery, a "magasin" for produce, Haagendaz store within a few minutes walk - safe, walked back hours after dark just fine - arr. 15/16 = nice part of paris!!! embassies, away from "touristy" - can be booked through Cos*co website for LOW rates Actual Facility: - Small but very nice Lobby area - Friendly, english speaking staff, concierge - very nice facades, decorations, aesthetics - key operate elevator - safer - late entry permitted only through main lobby section (as I saw) - clean - patio seating for "restaurant" very verdant Actual Room: We stayed in one of 200s. Excellent room. Euro-sized rooms, yet very nicely decorated. The TV stand showed some wear but it's a minor detail. The bathroom was small but emmaculate. Marble(faux most likely) floor and counters, styled tub. Everything was very clean. Double bed was actually two pushed together, common in Europe. Others: Our stay included breakfast. Cons: no to-go bag Pros: - Excellent coffee! - Excellent buffet with the creamest scrambled eggs, cheeses, fruit salad with kiwis, mango, pineapple and sprigs of vanilla on top. Various pastry selections with nutella, jam and butter. Great way to start a long day of walking around paris! - Note* if you take 1/2 and 1/2 with coffee, it doesn't exist in England or France, so get used to milk. I will not hesitate staying here again. The room did not have A/C like many many hotels, so in the summer, things might get a might toasty. Whole experience was great.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: gettingthere-7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights with my partner,my first time in paris,had heard french were very rude so was a bit anxious as t what to expect,boy i was not dissappointed taxi pulled up and before we were out of it our bags were in lobby,we were greeted by a lovely gentle spoken lady at reception,she checked us in ,then gave us tour of hotel and she brought us to our room,explaining all services. The room was so cosy,big room with poster bed,tv lots of everything,lovely bathroom and the toiletries i had to use as airline lost my suitcase,shampoo was lovelyas was body cream,and hotel replaced them next day. breakfast was absolutely devine,and all staff in this hotel are extremely helpful and courteous. as i mentioned my bag went missing,hotel staff got it tracked for me and phoned me and sent a letter to my room to say they had it. When we returned every evning,lights were on,two chocs on bed and weather forecast for following day. best hotel i have ever been in,and would definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Paris2411
Reviews.Content: What a hotel and what a stay!! Having been our first time in Paris we were nervous as to what we would find but I would descibe our time there as nothing but brilliant! The hotel is lovely which such friendly and accomodating staff. We were lucky enough to be updraded to a deluxe room (when we only booked a standard) which was fantastic - lovely and roomy with plenty of space. I must say we paid well below the price that was advertised on the board so a bit of negotiating is something we would recommend. The hotel bar, although expensive, is worth every penny and a glass of champagne should be shared by all who visit! The hotel is being taken over by Marriot in the new year so I hope they do the hotel justice! We'll certainly be back to inspect it!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location; but Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: acubeplus1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, a couple of minutes walk to Victor Hugo and Trocadero metro stations. Though our room was clean and looked lovely, it was small and a bit old. The breakfast at the hotel was one of the best I've ever had. I wouldn't return to this hotel --except for the breakfast-- because of the price tag. It is absolutely overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: danefield
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights last weekend and have to report that the experience was extremely good. The hotel is pricey but deals are available (3 nights for 2). Close to the Trocadero and the Eiffel Tower this is an excellent 'quiet' base for Paris visitors and sightseers. The bedrooms are clean and well sized (but not large), the staff are very attentive and the breakfast is excellent. Perhaps the bar could be a little less expensive, although the bombay mix is worth it! All in all, a very good choice for a stay in this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “New Name”
Reviews.Author: malcadam
Reviews.Content: Two thumbs up for this hotel. However note it is no longer a Sofitel. It is now a Marriott brand property as we stayed using our Marriott points.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jimtexas
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful, boutique style hotel in an outstanding neighborhood. The hotel staff members are proficient in English, are highly professional and courteous. The room I was given was larger than expected and quite comfortable. This was above par for hotel rooms in Paris. This is now my hotel of choice when not staying on the rive gauche.....I have my favorite there in St. Germain des Pres.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint stay in the 16th”
Reviews.Author: SimplyAmerican
Reviews.Content: A wonderful little hotel, friendly front desk, both front desk and concierge speak English. Room was good sized for Paris with the soft, comfortable sofitel bed. My room overlooked the courtyard, too, and it was a lovely view. I'm having trouble uploading pix but will try again. It's in a quieter area, so those who like to be in the thick of things may feel a bit on the outside, but to me, if felt like coming "home" each night. Quick walk in two directions to Metro. Concierge helpful. Everyone friendly! Would very much recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: KPScotland
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a great location! Staff friendly and pleasant! Rooms very clean and comfortable plus didn't hear any noise from other rooms! Beds fantastic!! Would stay here again and again! Nice area and handy for the metro! Easy walk to the Palais de Chaillot for a fantastic view of the Eiffel Tower!

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view!”
Reviews.Author: aa6nz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 days and it was a great visit. The concierge' was great and with his help I was able to master the metro. Going to the flea market and other sites around Paris. The hotel does need a good cleaning on the carpet but my room was charming and over looked the courtyard. Which was very quiet and we were awaken each morning by the sounds of birds chirping. Our stay cost us 3k in US $ for 8 days and this included breakfast each day. Most of our breakfasts were taken in the room as room service at no additional cost. The champagne I purchased went great with the orange juice included in the breakfast. The service was the best I have ever seen, whenever I called the front desk or room service, what ever I had asked for was at my door before I could even put my phone down. Now that's service! The little bar in the lobby was great for meeting other folks who were passing through and we meet some nice couples there and made friends with several of them. The location is great, 4 blocks to the Eiffel Tower and 3 blocks to Arc and 1 block to a Starbucks, grocery story, laundries cream shop,wine store, restaurants, bakeries, I can go on and on. Spend your money on Paris not the hotel....This is a great value for the money. Merci!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great beds”
Reviews.Author: JB1312
Reviews.Content: I took my Partner for his Birthday to this hotel. It was a breeze to get to from the Gare du Nord (Eurostar) on the Metro and is right in the middle of 2 Metro Stations (Victor Hugo and Trocadero). No more than a 3 minute walk. On arriving the staff were friendly and helpful. Their command of English was excellent and they even understood my pigeon French! The concierge was really helpful and does know his stuff. The room was small (we had a Superior room) but adequate - you don't live in your room! As for the bed... Fantastic! The bed you could get lost in with a down bottom sheet that moulded around you. As for the pillows they were the best I have even slept on. I wanted to bring them home in my suitcase. We had a view of the Eiffel Tower top which was fun. As a lot of other people have said the shower screen was a joke but hey you don't have to clean up so why worry? There wasn't a kettle to make a hot drink which was a disappointment to my Partner and the mini bar was expensive (E8 for a can of coke). However, this didn't stop me using the fridge for my own drinks overnight so again, no hardship. We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on this. There were some good restaurants, patisseries and a supermarket close by so there was no need to eat there. There's a good market close by (Rue Clare) where there are a number of good restaurants to sit at to ease the aching feet. A great place to sit and people watch was at the Bistro on the Trocadero that looks onto the Eiffel Tower - can't remember the name but you can't miss it just keep walking until you can see the Tower. The location is great. The Eiffel Tower is only minutes away and you can catch to RER from there to Versailles for a bargain price of a few euros. We like to walk when we go to Cities and this hotel was easy for that - very tiring but good and makes the bed even more welcome. The batobus (River bus) was by the tower as well. We got the Metro to the Sacre Coeur and that area. We bought one book of Carnet for the Metro (10 tickets - 1 per journey) for both of us. This was enough and both of us could use the book it wasn't one book per person as I first thought and reading the guide books. Overall the hotel is worthy of its 4 stars - yes, in places the paper was peeling slightly but nothing to worry about and the room was on the small side but the bed took up most of the room; as that was great the hotel can be forgiven. I expect good things in my hotels but I don't expect perfection and I wasn't dissapointed here. If I return to Paris I would stay at this hotel and would recommend this place to anyone.

HotelInfo.Name: Renaissance Paris Hotel Le Parc Trocadero
HotelInfo.Address: 55 - 57 Avenue Raymond Poincare | 16th Arr., 75116 Paris, France
